item.name: Blindfold of Tremorsense
entries: You can spend an action to pull this blindfold over your eyes. While the blindfold covers your eyes, you gain {@sense tremorsense} to a range of 10 feet, but you are completely blind beyond this radius. Removing the blindfold requires an action

item.name: Aria's Arrow
entries: This arrow is made of solid metal, with sharp, barbed spines along the arrowhead.

Aria's Arrow sings through the air at rapid speed when fired, dealing damage as normal on a hit. The arrowhead expands and embeds itself into whichever creature it strikes, and remains stuck in the creature's flesh until it is removed or the creature is slain. The arrow cannot embed itself in a creature that does not have organic flesh, such as most constructs, elementals, and oozes. While the arrow is embedded in a creature, the creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of it's turns. On a failed save, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

As an action, the target or a creature adjacent it can attempt to remove the arrow with a DC 15 Strength check. The target takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage when the arrow is removed. When the arrow is removed, any levels of {@condition exhaustion} applied by the arrow disappear.
Whenever the arrow is removed from a creature or its corpse, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the arrow snaps and crumbles to dust, forever destroyed.

item.name: Armor of Power
entries: While attuned to this armor, you gain the following benefits when you wear it:

items: You gain resistance to fire and poison damage.
You sink in water or similar liquids.
You can endure natural environments with temperatures of -43 to 140 degrees Celsius without needing to make Constitution checks.
You can amplify your voice to be audible out to a range of 300 feet.

entries: The armor is vacuumed sealed, allowing you to survive in a vacuum or pressurized environment.
The armor moves under its own power. Its weight doesn't count against your carrying capacity.
If you are reduced to 0 hit points while wearing this armor, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the armor's power source ruptures as per a retributive strike.

entries.name: Retributive Strike
entries: While wearing the armor, you can use an action to overload it, performing a retributive strike. The armor is destroyed and releases its remaining magic in an explosion that expands to fill a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on it.
You have a {@chance 50|50 percent} chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion.

If you fail to avoid the effect, you take damage equal your maximum hit points. Every other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes force damage equal to your maximum hit points, or half as much on a successful saving throw.

item.name: Adjatha the Drinker
entries: This blade belonged to Dabbar, a long dead servant of Bhaal that exercised control over his minions in the most brutal of ways. In addition to strengthening the mind against the guile of others, the sword absorbs life energy from an opponent with each successful hit, healing the user. Dabbar considered it a failure of his officers if he returned from battle in less than perfect health, and as the rest of the company watched, he would administer beatings until fully healed.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a living target you get 1 temporary hit point, also while you are attuned to the Adjatha the Drinker, you can't be {@condition charmed}.

item.name: Albruin
entries: Basalin was a large man, rumored, far from his hearing, to be a werebear. He long wielded the sword Albruin in the protection of his village, slaying giant spiders that plagued the area. The sword protected him from their poison and also allowed him to see {@condition invisible} Red Wizards who controlled some of the more fantastic variants. The reason for their enmity is unknown.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While you are attuned to the Albruin you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition and have immunity to poison damage. You can use an action to cast {@spell see invisibility} on self. The Albruin can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Cheetah Speed
entries: This amulet grants its wearer fleetness of foot. Not surprisingly it is popular among fleeing felons, travelers and cowards.

You gain bonus 10 ft to your walking speed. Additionally, you can use action to invoke power of amulet to cast {@spell haste} on self. Amulet of Cheetah Speed can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

item.name: Amulet of Spell Warding
entries: A favorite item of protection for a mage entering a magical duel, this amulet provides protection against spells, but does not interfere with the mage's own spellcasting.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells while you wear this amulet.

item.name: Angurvadal
entries: Also known as the Stream of Anguish, this is the legendary burning blade of Frithiof.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit with an attack using this magic sword, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage.
Additionally, you can use action to invoke power of Angurvadal to raise your Strength up to 22 for 1 minute.
Angurvadal can't be used this way again until the next dawn

item.name: Shisui, Water Slasher
entries: Masters of movement and manipulators of momentum, the river ronin were protectors of the waterways.
Legend says such samurai could control water with their ki, forming it into shields, whips and whirlpools.
These blades, known as the shisui, gave the ronin the ability to conjure water to wield in even the driest deserts or most remote mountaintops.
This weapon has 5 charges and regains expended ld4 + 1 charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Aqua Conjuration
entries: As an action you can expend 1 charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} spell but only to create water or you may expend 1 charge to cast {@spell control water} (save DC 17).

entries.name: Torrent
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can expend 1 charge to fire a torrent of water from your blade. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the attack action, this effect replaces one of them. You create a 2-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line of high pressure water. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or either be pushed 5 feet back or be knocked {@condition prone} (your choice).

entries.name: Jet
entries: As an action, you can expend 2 charges to propel yourself forward in a straight line up to 30 feet long to an unoccupied space you can see. Each creature in a 10-foot-wide line between your origin and your destination must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw as high powered jets of water slice into them. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} slashing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

item.name: Ruination
entries: When you attune to Ruination a scar of an arcane brand appears on your palm.
Once attuned you gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded down (minimum 1).

With the weapon in your scared hand you can use a bonus action to cause the blade to glow red hot. The heated blade sheds dim light in a 10 ft radius and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage to any target it hits. The blade remains hot until you use a bonus action to cool the blade or until you drop or sheathe the sword. ⁣ ⁣In addition, as part of an attack with the red hot blade you can cause it to become molten and elongate into a whip. ⁣ The weapon remains a whip until you mentally command it to revert to the red hot blade (no action required) or you drop it. ⁣ The fire from the whip sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you hit a large or smaller creature with the whip, you can dismiss any non fire damage inflicted and instead force the creature to make a contested {@skill Athletics} (Strength) or {@skill Acrobatics} (Dexterity) check. If you win the contest, you can either: knock it {@condition prone}, grapple it, pull it 5 feet towards you, or force it to drop an item it is holding. On subsequent turns a creature {@condition grappled} by the whip suffers {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the end of its turn.

entries.name: Branded
entries: You can cast {@spell Heat Metal} on Ruination as a reaction to a creature you can see within 60ft holding the weapon.

item.name: Stormsiren
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. On a hit it deals an additional {@damage 1d8} Lightning damage.
The sword has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Flash Step
entries: As an action, you can expend a charge of this weapon to instantly travel in a 30 ft line to an unoccupied space. You can choose to make an attack with this weapon against any creatures you move through while making this movement' Any creature hit takes an additional ld8 lightning damage.

entries.name: Thunder Step
entries: As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} at the 3th level When you cast the spell this way, the spell save DC is 17.

item.name: Bronze Bulwark
entries: The shield has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Repelling Blast
entries: When you are hit by a melee attack while holding this shield you can use your reaction to spend 1 charge and release a blast of repulsive energy, forcing the attacker to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed up to 30 feet directly away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Deflection
entries: You can also use this repelling property to attempt to deflect projectiles. When you're hit by a ranged weapon attack roll, you can use your reaction to spend 1 charge to force the attacker to reroll the attack roll and use the new roll's result.

entries.name: Surf's Up
entries: The shield is also capable of producing a gentle repelling field when placed on a liquid, allowing it to hover a few inches off the surface. While hovering in this way, you can stand on the shield and speak its command word to make it glide across the liquid. You control the movement and trajectory of the shield, which has a speed of 60 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds. If you take damage while riding the shield in this way, you must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check or fall {@condition prone} off of the shield.

item.name: Onikiri, Demon Cutter
entries: This magic weapon has 5 charges and regains expended ld4 + 1 charges daily at dawn. You can cast the {@spell light} cantrip on the blade at will.

entries.name: Radiant Wrath
entries: As a bonus action while holding the blade, you can expend 1 charge to imbue it with crackling radiant energy until the end of your next turn. While imbued, each time you hit a creature with an attack using this blade, it takes an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. In addition each fiend within 10 feet of your target must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} radiant damage as crackling, radiant energy arcs out towards it.

entries.name: Demon Lure
entries: As a bonus action while holding the blade, you can expend 1 charge to draw the attention of one creature you can see within 30 feet of you, forcing it to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. A creature with the fiend type makes this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, the creature becomes fixated on you. For the next minute the creature's speed is reduced to 0 and it is {@condition incapacitated}. This effect ends if you attack any other creature, if you cast a spell, if the target of this property is affected by a spell cast by a creature friendly to you, or creature or if a creature friendly to you damages the target of this effect.

entries.name: Blessed
entries: You can speak Celestial fluently and can expend a charge to cast {@spell protection from evil and good}, no concentration required, protecting the target from fiends only.

item.name: Ring of Great Success
entries: This ring was created by a wizard who valued planning and good tactics. If its wearer can secure advantageous conditions, the ring can help him achieve great success

While wearing this ring, whenever you roll attack roll or ability check with advantage and have the same roll on both of the dice, you can treat that {@dice d20} roll as a 20. Additionally, when an attack roll is made against you with disadvantage, and attacker has the same roll on both of the dice, you can treat that {@dice d20} roll as a 1.

item.name: Gloves of the Rime Keepers
entries: The warmest care comes from the coldest hands. This item has 5 charges and regains all charges at dawn. Whenever you take an instance of cold damage from a spell or ability, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, this item regains a charge.

entries.name: Keep on Ice
entries: As an action, you can spend a charge to cast {@spell Spare the Dying} as icy frost stabilizes the target. You can spend 2 charges to cast {@spell Gentle Repose}, freezing a creature's body to keep it preserved for the duration.

entries.name: Coldhearted
entries: As an action you can spend 2 charges to harden the heart of a creature you touch with frosty protection. For the next minute the creature has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} as the chill focuses their minds against invasion. This ability has no effect on undead or constructs.

entries.name: Frosty Embrace
entries: While attuned to this item, whenever you use a spell or ability to heal a creature, you can spend any number of charges to have the target gain a number of temporary hit points equal to five times the number of charges spent.

item.name: Mithril Armband
entries: You have a critical hit range of 19-20 while attuned and wearing this item.
This has 6 charges item and regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn.

items: You can use your bonus action to expend 1 charge to add +3 to your attack rolls this turn.
You can use your bonus action to expend 4 charges to make your critical hit range 18-20 for the next minute.

item.name: Razorpetal Longbow
entries: This bow is shaped from an enchanted flower. Embedded along its surface are hundreds of fragrant, razor-sharp petals.

As a bonus action while wielding the bow you can cause the petals to erupt into an airborne flurry that swirls around you for 1 minute. While the whirlwind of petals is active you have half cover and attacks with this bow deal an additional {@damage 1d4} slashing damage as petals fly alongside your arrows to slash at your targets. Additionally, if a creature touches you or hits you with a melee attack while this effect is active, it takes {@damage 1d4} slashing damage. The petals fall lifelessly to the ground at the end of the minute. The bow cannot be used again this way until the petals regrow at dawn.
Shandra left the imprint of a kiss in scarlet red lipstick and a shower of petals on the bodies of her victims, each horrifically lacerated by ten thousand tiny blades.

item.name: Pearl of Truth
entries: While holding this pearl, you can cast the spell zone of truth as an action once per day. The spell save DC is 12 and its duration is 10 minutes. This ability recharges at dawn each day

item.name: Potion of Blindsight
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain {@sense blindsight} in a 60-foot-radius for 1 hour.
The effect does not hinder your normal vision but allows you to "see" in absolute darkness while the potion lasts. The liquid inside the vial is viscous and inky in color

item.name: Mjolnir
entries: requires proficiency in {@skill Religion}

When the famous dwarven brother Brock and Sindri were challenged by Loki to prove their skill in smithing against the Sons of Ivaldi, they forged three great artifacts, the last and most powerful of which was the mighty warhammer Mjolnir, specifically designed for the god Thor.
The wielder of Mjolnir becomes the Champion of the god Thor and automatically gains proficiency in {@skill Athletics} and in the use of warhammers.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. Immediately after the ranged attack or at your command, the weapon flies back to your hand.
When you hit an enemy, whether melee or ranged, it deals {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d8} thunder damage.
Mjolnir has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (Save DC 18):
Mjolnir regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, Mjolnir disappears forever.

item.name: Gungnir
entries: When the Sons of Ivaldi were challenged by Loki to prove their skill in smithing against the famous dwarven brother Brock and Sindri, they forged three great artifacts, one of which was the powerful golden spear Gungnir, specifically designed for the god Odin.
To receive this weapon, one must complete a Penance of Charity.
Gungnir is a one-time use weapon. Once used, it returns to the divine realm of Asgard.

When you activate this weapon (as a bonus action), its raw power destroys all armor and shielding devices you are wearing, absorbing its pieces to make itself stronger, leaving you with a base AC of 10 and giving you 2 points of {@condition exhaustion}.

The benefit of this sacrifice however, is that it transforms the spear into an unerring missile. As an action, you can hurl it at any target you can see (with no distance penalty). The spear ignores the target's AC, dealing {@damage 5d8} piercing damage{@damage  + 15d8} radiant damage.
There is no attack roll required for this weapon and no saving throw can defend from it.

item.name: Eye of Odin
entries: This artifact is the right eye of the God Odin, sacrificed when hanging upside-down from the world tree
Yggdrassil, in exchange for knowledge of the future. It is a white orb covered in blue arcane runes, with a single glowing blue circle in the place of an iris.
To attune to the Eye of Odin, you must gouge out your own right eye and place the artifact in the empty socket. If the eye is ever removed, you die.
You gain Truesight, and you can use an action to see through walls.
The Eye has 8 charges to cast one of the following spells (Save DC18):
The Eye regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges at dawn.
Each time you cast a spell from the Eye, there is a 5% chance that your soul will be claimed to join the halls of Valhalla.

item.name: Hand of Tyr
entries: This artifact is the right hand of the God of Justice-Tyr, bitten off just below the wrist by the monstrous wolf
Fenrir when he attempted to chain the creature.
To attune to the Hand of Tyr, you must chop off your right hand at the wrist and place the artefact against the stump. If the hand is ever removed, you die.
Your strength score becomes 20
Any melee spell attack or weapon attack from the hand deals an additional {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage
The Hand of Tyr has 8 charges to cast one of the following spells (Save DC18)
The Hand regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges at dawn.
Each time you cast a spell from the Hand, it casts {@spell Suggestion} on you to commit one act of selfless charity that day.

item.name: Sifjar
entries: Challenged by Loki to produce wondrous artifacts, the Sons of Ivaldi forged a golden headpiece to restore the Goddess Sif's short hair.
However, this is actually a Mimic that has been enchanted to obey the wearer and can transform itself to take the form and function of any armor or clothing.
The armor is considered light armor and provides 13 AC + your Dexterity Modifier.
You gain Resistance to Acid, Poison, Piercing, Slashing and Bludgeoning damage and Vulnerability to Thunder and Psychic damage.
You gain Advantage to stealth checks: The mimic is capable of blending into its surroundings when commanded to take an appropriately stealthy form.
You gain Advantage on Dexterity saving throws: The mimic tries to protect itself by protecting you from any unexpected dangers.
If the wearer dies, the mimic sacrifices itself to return the wearer to 1HP.
The armor can do the following actions:

entries.name: Acid Splash
entries: As an action a target must make a DC13 Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 1d6} Acid Damage.

entries.name: Shapeshift
entries: As an action Mimic can be commanded to consume {@dice 1d6} of the wearer's HP to reset the shape of the armor.

entries.name: Grapple
entries: As a bonus action Mimic can be commanded to stretch out its pseudopod limbs to attempt to grapple a target creature (DC13 Strength Save). You gain advantage on hitting the {@condition grappled} creature.

item.name: Drachenstahl
entries: This charred obsidian blade is crafted from a fragment of the legendary flaming sword of the Fire Giant Surtur.
The bronze handle of this blade is shaped in the form of a roaring dragon breathing fire.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon
The blade grants the wielder resistance to fire damage and advantage on all saving throws against spells and other magical effects
Each successful attack gathers one charge, lighting up one of the 8 empty rubies set into the handle.
With each successful attack, one or more gathered ruby charges can be spent to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} Fire Damage per charge.
As a reaction, the sword can also absorb any oncoming Fire Damage up to {@dice 1d6} x number of empty rubies.
Wielder can spend 3 charges to cast {@spell Burning Hands}
Wielder can spend 8 charges to cast {@spell Fireball}
Each day at dawn, {@dice 1d6 + 2} gathered charges fade away.

item.name: Solsverte
entries: This sword is said to have once belonged to the God
Freyr and was associated with summer, sunshine and fair weather.
This item appears to be a plain longsword hilt.
However, when grasping the hilt, you can cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Each attack deals {@damage 1d10} Radiant Damage (instead of slashing damage). When you hit an undead with it, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.
A Proficiency with longswords allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

entries.name: Sunrise
entries: You can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear

entries.name: Special Powers
entries: The Solsverte has 8 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (Save DC 18):
Solsverte regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the Solsverte disappears forever.

item.name: Fjelljeger
entries: This beautifully crafted yew bow is said to have been crafted by the mountain goddess Skadi, for the purpose of hunting monstrous wild animals. Wrapped in rare animal furs, this bow is covered with dozens of tiny icicles that never melt.
As revenge against Loki for causing the death of her father Thiazi, Skadi placed a terrifying serpent that constantly drips venom onto the bound Loki.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
A Proficiency with longbows allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
Each attack deals {@damage 1d8} Piercing Damage and {@damage 2d6} Cold Damage.
The wielder of this longbow is immune to all cold damage and cold weather effects.
When attuned to this artifact, the wielder is immune to fear and charm effects.

entries.name: Loki's Prison
entries: When the wielder hits with an attack, they can declare a Venom {@action Attack}. The target must make a DC18 Constitution save. Upon failure, they are considered {@condition poisoned}, taking an additional {@damage 8d8} poison damage. Upon success, they take half as much poison damage. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The wielder needs to finish a short or long rest before using this ability again.

entries.name: Special Powers
entries: The Fjelljeger has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (Save DC 18):
Fjelljeger regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the Fjelljeger melts away into water, disappearing forever.

item.name: Abacus of Mathematics
entries: The beads on this silver abacus hum and faintly glow when moved, revealing the abacus's magical nature.

The abacus has 3 charges, and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, when a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge, roll a {@dice d6}, and add or subtract the number rolled from the attack roll, ability check, or damage roll.

item.name: Azuza's Pearlescent Pen
entries: This quill pen is brightly colored, with each feather strand being colored in a different neon palette.
This pen doesn't require ink. Instead, by speaking the name of a color, you can make the pen magically write with ink of that color.
No matter what color you choose, the ink always has a bright, reflective sheen to it.

While you are holding the pen, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your artificer or wizard spells. In addition, if you use this pen to copy a spell into your wizard spellbook, the gold you must spend to do so is halved.
As an action, you can hold the pen in your hand and cause a dazzling series of lights to shine from the pen. Each creature in a

60-foot cone originating from the pen must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. Once this property of the pen has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Al-Bakasha's Sword of Buoyancy
entries: A finely crafted short sword with a comfortable leather grip, and a small decorative chain that hangs about four inches from the smooth brass pommel.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Each attack does {@damage 2d6} slashing or piercing damage.
The bearer of this sword gets +2 to all Dexterity Saving Throws.
Also, the bearer is capable of normal movement while suspended in air, either in the elemental plane of air, in the ethereal plane, and while levitating.

item.name: Fresh Dagger
entries: A small dagger with a wavy steel blade, and a textured wooden handle. The entire dagger is abnormally clean, and smells strongly of freshly sliced orange.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Whoever wields this dagger automatically subtracts 6 from any necrotic damage they take.
No matter what happens to the dagger, it cannot become dirty or soiled in any way.

item.name: Butterfly Ring
entries: An ornate ring of jade and gold, fashioned in the shape of a butterfly. It is pleasantly cool to the touch.
The wearer of this ring gains an additional 10 feet to all jumping attempts.

Should the wearer fall, either landing from a jump, or falling further, the wearer only falls slowly, as per the {@spell Feather Fall} spell. The wearer takes no damage from falls, and doesn't need to make Dexterity checks to land on difficult terrain. This ability does not extend to others.

item.name: Colwidth's Thinking Cap
entries: A multicolored cloth cap that is particularly unattractive. It appears to have been sewn together from colorful rags, and has annoying tassels that hang down into the face of the wearer.

Wearing the thinking cap increases the intelligence of the wearer by 6 points. When the thinking cap is removed, the wearer becomes sleepy and must sleep for {@dice 1d8} turns per turn that the thinking cap was worn. Those who wear the cap, but are immune to magical sleep are instead {@condition paralyzed} for the duration.

item.name: Pocket Gloves
entries: A pair of thin, brown, wool gloves, fraying but sturdy, with the fingertips removed.
Wearing these gloves conveys a triple normal proficiency bonus to using {@item thieves' tools|PHB} regardless of class.

item.name: Camo Jacket
entries: A jacket of thin wool material, covered in splotches of earth tone colors.
It cannot be worn with armor.
Wearing this jacket grants a +4 bonus to {@skill Stealth}.

item.name: Really Useful Rope
entries: A length of hemp rope, 10' long, ending in a sturdy loop on both sides. Fine threads of blue and green can be seen woven in with the hemp upon close inspection.
As long as this rope is worn or carried, you gain +1 to your proficiency bonus.
You may choose a single skill, in which you are already proficient. Gain an additional +1 to your proficiency bonus for that skill.

item.name: Shiny Lightning Necklace
entries: A small golden lightning bolt shaped charm hanging from a woven cord.
This necklace empowers the wearer with a reflexive and automatic ability that will occur as a reaction up to two times daily.

Whenever the wearer is about to suffer damage that would bring them below 10 HP, that player is spared the total damage in that turn. The necklace simultaneously deals {@damage 3d12} lightning damage to the attacker.

item.name: Tony the Basilisk Hunter's Goggles
entries: A pair of steel canisters mounted in a leather strap which buckles around the face. The canisters end in polished gemstone lenses, and are inscribed with finely etched runes and glyphs on all sides.

Wearing Tony the Basilisk Hunter's Goggles gives one absolute protection from the petrifying gaze of Basilisks and other similar monsters. The goggles also remove Darkvision, the ability to see normal colors, and any other natural or magical sight based abilities, including spells that allow for magical augmentations to sight. Because of this, immunity to magical darkness is also provided by these goggles, even though normal darkness is still too dark too see through.

Everything viewed through Tony the Basilisk Hunter's Goggles appears in various shades of monochrome purple. For this reason, the wearer receives a -2 penalty to all {@skill Perception} checks based on sight.

item.name: Cataphract Gauntlets
entries: These black iron gauntlets seem to grant the wearer the strength to wield the heaviest and most devastating weapons, and rain down a hail of crushing blows upon the enemy.

entries.name: Brutal Blows
entries: When you make a melee attack using Strength with a weapon that has the Heavy property, you gain a +2 bonus to that attack roll.

entries.name: Relentless
entries: These gauntlets can hold up to three charges and regain all expended charges when you complete a long rest.
You can expend one charge to use a bonus action to make a single melee attack using Strength with a weapon that has the Heavy property.

item.name: Deck of Piercing
entries: This deck of 52 throwing cards is magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.
It grants +1 to hit, but does not grant a bonus to damage rolls.
On a hit, roll a {@dice d12}.
On a critical hit, the card automatically uses the {@damage d12} damage die.
You have proficiency with this weapon if you have proficiency with the {@item Playing Card Set |PHB}.
Thrown cards return to the deck after one round.

item.name: The Bow of a Thousand Arrows
entries: When you attack with this weapon and roll at least a 15 on the die, the arrow that is shot multiplies into a volley of arrows. All creatures within a 30 foot cone in front of you, pointed in the direction of the original target of your attack, must succeed on a DC 20 dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d8} damage. A creature that successfully saves takes half damage. The original arrow also still hits the original target as normal.

item.name: Climber's Gloves
entries: These metal gauntlets serve as piercing hooks to claw out handholds in the sheerest surfaces, and can bite deep into even solid rock.

entries.name: Grip of Steel
entries: While wearing these gloves you gain a climb speed of 20 feet. If you already have a climb speed, your climb speed increases by 10 feet instead. In addition, while wearing these gloves, you can have your unarmed strikes deal slashing or piercing damage equal to 3 + your strength modifier instead of your regular unarmed damage.

entries.name: Part of the Whole
entries: You can attune to the Boots of the Climber, the Climber's Gloves and the Climber's Harness using the same attunement slot.

item.name: Boots of the Climber
entries: These sturdy boots strap firmly to the wearer's calves, and have metal shod soles and spikes to grip to smallest footholds in stony walls and cliff faces.

entries.name: Spiked Grip
entries: While wearing these boots you gain a climb speed of 20 feet. If you already have a climb speed, your climb speed increases by 10 feet instead.

entries.name: Part of the Whole
entries: You can attune to the Boots of the Climber, the Climber's Gloves and the Climber's Harness using the same attunement slot.

item.name: Climber's Harness
entries: Comprised of loops of corded leather and tightly braided rope slung through metal hoops with biting hooks attached to the ends, this harness can be affixed to any attire by the use of belts and straps to distribute the weight evenly.

entries.name: Slinger's Line
entries: The harness can be used as a grappling hook and is attached to a 20 foot length of rope that is enchanted to extend up to 60 feet when thrown. The rope cannot be cut or severed unless it is exposed to an antimagic field.

entries.name: Quick Reflexes
entries: While wearing this harness, you can use a reaction when you fall to throw out a grappling hook. Make a thrown weapon attack, treating it as a simple weapon with the Finesse and Thrown (Range 20/60) properties. On a hit you successfully hit the anchor point and your fall is arrested by the rope. You take no damage when you do so.

entries.name: Part of the Whole
entries: You can attune to the Boots of the Climber, the Climber's Gloves and the Climber's Harness using the same attunement slot.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: While wearing the sandals your movement speed increases by 20ft.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: Once awakened and attuned, the sandals gain the ability to harness a number of charges equal to your proficiency modifier x2. These charges are replenished at a rate of {@dice 2d6} charges per dawn. When you spend these charges you suffer {@dice 1d4} points of Lighting damage per charge used but can activate the following features.

entries.name: Speed Increase
entries: You can use your bonus action to spend charges to increase your speed. For every 1 charge you spend your movement speed is increased by 10ft. The Speed Increase is active for the next 1 minute.

entries.name: Boost
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a Speed Increase you can spend charges to boost your movement speed. For every 3 charges you spend your movement speed is doubled. The Boost is active for the next 1 minute.

When you activate the Speed Increase and/or Boost, you can spend up to as many charges as you have available, but you can have only one active Speed Increase and/or Boost active at any given time. If you attempt to magically increase your speed by any other means while you have an active Speed Increase and/or Boost Active the effect fails. All expended charges are replenished at dawn.
During your turn if your movement speed exceeds;

items: 150, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks against you are made at disadvantage.
200, you can use your reaction to move up to half your movement speed when an enemy ends their turn within 5ft of you. In addition, all opportunity attacks made against you are made at disadvantage.
250, all attacks against you are made at disadvantage.
300, you gain an additional action. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, Disengage, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

774, you can push the boot so fast you become a near {@condition invisible} blur and appear to teleport to a location. This effect functions as if you cast the {@spell Teleport} spell (no action required) targeting a Very Familiar Location. You can choose any location on the same plane that is not magically secured from entry. Results other than "On Target" are considered to be "Mishaps" such as running into objects or getting lost. This movement ravages your body causing 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} if you are "On Target" or 2 if you have a "Mishap".

item.name: Dragon Turtle Plate
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC, and you have resistance to fire damage while wearing this armor fashioned from a dragon turtle hatchling's shell.

As an action, you can exhale scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 9d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage. The armor can't be used this way again until you complete a long rest.

If you are knocked {@condition prone} while wearing this armor, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, you fall on your back. To stand up, you must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity check on your turn and then use all your movement for that turn. Another player may use their action to get you on your feet.

item.name: Captain's Coat
entries: Functional and fashionable, this long pirate captain's coat is reinforced for combat and draws the eyes to its ornate design. While wearing this coat, you have proficiency in {@item navigator's tools|PHB}, vehicles (water) and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Multiple pockets are hidden on the inside of the coat, able to conceal small objects. A creature attempting to search your person must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check in order to discover the hidden pockets.

entries.name: Sailor's Mouth
entries: Once per short rest, you can use a bonus action to cast the {@spell vicious mockery} spell (save DC 15) while wearing the coat. When cast in this way, the target takes extra psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

item.name: Yves' Thieves' Tools
entries: You have a +1 bonus to ability checks using these {@item thieves' tools|PHB}. As an action you can hold these tools up to a door to hear through it, as long as it's no thicker than 1 foot, alerting you to the location of any creatures within 20 feet of the door. If you set off a trap while using these tools to pick a lock, you have advantage on any saving throws to resist the trap.

item.name: Sand Maiden
entries: This padded armor is a billowing assemblage of earth-colored cloth that seems to flow with the wind as if made of sand itself. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Padded armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks, this armor doesn't.

Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws you make against {@condition exhaustion} effects due to extreme heat. You gain the ability to glide across the desert, while you are on sand you ignore difficult terrain.

As an action you can transform into the aspect of the sand maiden. For 1 minute, or until you end this transformation with a bonus action, your skin glimmers like a mirage and you move like a swirling sandstorm. While in this state you gain the following benefits:
You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
You can move through the space of another creature and pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though you treat liquids as though they were solid surfaces.
Your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Your speed increases by 20 feet.
The armor can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

The Sand Maiden was the ruler of the dunes. Her shifting visage was stunning to behold, appearing to embody the form most desirous to a desperate onlooker. Those who had tested themselves against the vast expanse of her domain and failed would be visited by her in their final moments. Only those who have survived this encounter know what pact is offered in exchange for mercy.

This cloth armor was woven from loose strands of her hair found drifting across the desert contour. Dunefolk treasure this material for its magical properties that bestow a fraction of the maiden's power upon the wearer.

item.name: Aquatic Symbiote
entries: This fleshy mass pulses with life and twitches when touched. If you allow this creature to merge with your body you gain adaptations suited for an aquatic environment. You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. You must immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour every day, or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} at the end of that day. You can only recover from this {@condition exhaustion} through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour. Additionally, when you merge with the symbiote, you can choose one of the following adaptations:

entries.name: Bioluminescence
entries: Your skin develops luminous patches or you grow a slender stalk from your head that dangles a mass of luminescent flesh at the end. As a bonus action you can activate or deactivate your bioluminescence, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. As an action you can create a dazzling display and attempt to allure a creature within 20 feet of you that can see you. The creature must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute on a failure. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way is {@condition incapacitated} and moves towards you at half speed on each of its turns. The creature can remake this save at the beginning of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, ending the effect on a success. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Venomous Spines
entries: Rows of thin spines protrude from your skin, coated with neurotoxic mucus. As a reaction, when a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can retaliate with venomous spines. Make an unarmed strike against the attacker, dealing {@dice 1d4} piercing on a hit and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} poison damage and becoming {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failure. Once you hit a creature, this property cannot be used again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Ink Sacs
entries: You develop three sacs filled with an inky black substance. As an action while underwater you can secrete the contents of one sac to create an opaque ink cloud in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on yourself. The sphere spreads around corners, its area is heavily obscured, and it counts as difficult terrain to creatures other than yourself. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong current disperses it. You regenerate all expended ink sacs when you complete a long rest.

Removing the attunement to the symbiote takes 1 hour of incredibly painful surgery, which must be performed by another creature. During this process, you are {@condition incapacitated} and take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage every 10 minutes. This damage ignores resistance and immunity. If you are reduced to 0 hit points or the process is interrupted, the removal fails. If the process is a success, the attunement ends and the symbiote is destroyed.

item.name: Verdant Slip
entries: This deep green vegan-leather armor is wreathed in living leaves. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor and advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in verdant terrain.

Once per day, you can use an action to cast the {@spell tree stride} spell from the armor. When tree stride is cast using this armor, each time you emerge from a tree you have advantage on the first attack you make before the end of your turn.

item.name: Scale Mail of the Pangolin
entries: While wearing this armor you gain a burrowing speed of 10 feet. You can use your burrowing speed to move through sand, loose earth, mud, or ice, not solid rock.

This armor can adjust itself to provide superior protection, allowing you to curl up into a ball as an action. Until you emerge (on your turn, no action required), you gain a +5 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While curled up, you are {@condition prone}, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and you are {@condition incapacitated}. {@action Attack} rolls made against you do not have advantage normally granted by the {@condition prone} condition. Additionally, a creature can roll you along the ground in front of itself if it succeeds on a DC 10 Strength check (no action required).

entries.name: Amplified
entries: This armor is a piece of the Underbrush Rustlers set. If you attune to another Underbrush Rustlers set piece while attuned to this armor, it gains the following attributes:

One other set piece: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before curling up into a ball, your momentum rolls you forward an additional 20 feet or until you hit a Small or larger creature or obstacle. A Large or smaller creature in your rolling path must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
Two other set pieces: While wearing this armor, if you are subjected to less than 10 slashing damage from a single attack, you instead take no slashing damage.

The Underbrush Rustlers are guardians of all woodland creatures, wearing the remains of their fallen pangolin kin as a grim reminder of this commitment. Crafted from the shedded scales of a dire pangolin, this suit of armor provides superb protection if you're willing to get down and dirty in it.

item.name: Crystal Skull of the Hot Spring King
entries: This crimson monkey skull is carved entirely from blood garnet and weighs 4 pounds. An aura of feral sentience draws your gaze.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If you stare into the eye sockets of the crystal skull for 1 minute it will transform itself to match the appearance of your own skull. Your race and appearance will change to that of a humanoid snow monkey. You have the bright red face of a macaque, and a body covered with shaggy brownish-gray fur. All of your racial traits, except for your size, alignment and languages, are replaced by those of a snow monkey. These include:

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity and your Constitution score each increase by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: You age at twice the rate of your previous form.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a climbing speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Humanoid
entries: Your creature type is humanoid.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Deep Sleeper
entries: It takes you 10 hours to finish a long rest and you regain all spent hit dice when you complete one.

entries.name: Kleptomaniacal
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand} skill. Once per long rest, when you see an item of value make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or you must attempt to steal the object regardless of the consequences. The DM determines which objects attract your attention.

entries.name: Mistrustful
entries: You are quick to assume ill-intent and have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.

entries.name: Thermal Tolerance
entries: You have resistance to cold and fire damage.

The remove curse spell is unable to reverse this effect. The only way is to stare into the eye sockets of the skull for 1 minute, after which you may attempt a DC 18 Wisdom check. If you succeed, both yourself and the skull revert back to their usual forms. If you fail the check, nothing happens and this check can't be attempted again until the next dawn. The effect can also be ended by a wish spell.
When the lord of bathing was laid to rest, all the monks sang out and beat their chests.
In the steaming pools where he held his court, the noblemen bickered over his hot spring resort.
The wealth he'd amassed was splendid and vast. A sarcophagus of gold for his crystal bones cast.
Beneath the snow-blown hills of his kingly domain, they carved a tomb and chiseled his name.
Deep down he waits for an inquisitive pawn, his flesh has gone rotten, but his greed lingers on.
If you stare too deep into his crimson eye holes, a new shape you'll take to fit in his mold.
Best beware and take care not to lose your head, lest you spend your life living his life instead!

item.name: Ring of X Enhancement
entries: The ring enhances the wielder's ability to deal damage.
While wearing the ring you gain +1 to damage of a certain damage type.

item.name: Swords of Dungeons & Dragons
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic weapon, which can also be wielded as a magic morningstar with the same bonuses.
The weapon also grants you a +2 bonus to your Armor Class
The weapon has 1 charge, which it recharges daily at dawn.
As an action, you can spend the charge to conjure a gold dragon wyrmling. The dragon disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or after 1 minute.

The dragon is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the dragon, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you).If you don't issue any commands to the dragon, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.
If you score a critical hit with the weapon on a creature CR 1 or higher, it regains 1 charge.

item.name: Mirror Shield
entries: The face of this ornate shield has the reflective properties of a mirror, but with incredible durability.
While you wield it,you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

When you are hit by an attack that deals damage of any type except bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, you can use your reaction to absorb the attack. If you do so,the damage is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your Constitution modifier, and the shield gains that many charges.

As part of the same reaction used to absorb an attack, you can unleash energy absorbed by the shield by expending any number of charges from the shield and make a ranged spell attack using Constitution as your spellcasting ability.
On a hit, the target takes damage equal to the number of charges spent. The damage is your choice of any type that the shield has absorbed since your last long rest.

The shield can hold up to 20 charges and loses all charges when you finish a long rest. If the shield would gain more charges than its maximum, it gains only enough charges to reach its maximum and you take any remaining damage.

item.name: Arcane Crystal (Small)
entries: These crystals can fit in the palm of your hand. They vary in color and give benefits to the user depending on the color.
When you take damage of the crystal's type, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage of that type by {@dice 1d4}.

The crystal has 5 charges, you can expend a charge to cast a cantrip corresponding to the color of the crystal, as shown in the table below. The range of the cantrip becomes 30 feet, and has a {@hit 4} to hit and a spell save DC of 12.The cantrip is cast as if the caster is 1st level.
If you have more than 2 crystals on you,they become temporarily inert due to interference and you cannot use the charges and the absorption ability.

items: Light Blue-Cold reduction, {@spell Ray of Frost}

item.name: Arcane Crystal (Regular)
entries: These crystals are typically the size of a longsword hilt. They vary in color and give benefits to the user depending on the color.
When you take damage of the crystal's type, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage of that type by {@dice 2d4}.

The crystal has 15 charges, you can expend a charge to cast a cantrip corresponding to the color of the crystal, as shown in the table below. The range of the cantrip becomes 60 feet, and has a {@hit 5} to hit and a spell save DC of 13.The cantrip is cast as if the caster is 5th level.
If you have more than 2 crystals on you,they become temporarily inert due to interference and you cannot use the charges and the absorption ability.

items: Light Blue-Cold reduction, {@spell Ray of Frost}

item.name: Arcane Crystal (Large)
entries: These crystals are typically the size of a longsword. They vary in color and give benefits to the user depending on the color.
When you take damage of the crystal's type, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage of that type by {@dice 3d4}.

The crystal has 20 charges, you can expend a charge to cast a cantrip corresponding to the color of the crystal, as shown in the table below. The range of the cantrip becomes 90 feet, and has a {@hit 7} to hit and a spell save DC of 15.The cantrip is cast as if the caster is 5th level.
You can also expend 3 charges to cast a spell in the crystal at it's lowest level.
If you have more than 2 crystals on you,they become temporarily inert due to interference and you cannot use the charges and the absorption ability.

items: Black------Necrotic reduction, {@spell Toll the Dead|XGE},{@spell Arms of Hadar}
Blue-------Lightning reduction, {@spell Shocking Grasp},{@spell Witch Bolt}
Dark Green-Acid reduction, {@spell Acid Splash},{@spell Chromatic Orb} as Acid
Green------Poison reduction, {@spell Poison Spray},{@spell Ray of Sickness}
Light Blue-Cold reduction, {@spell Ray of Frost},{@spell Armor of Agathys}
Red--------Fire reduction, {@spell Fire Bolt},{@spell Burning Hands}
Purple-----Psychic reduction, {@spell Vicious Mockery},{@spell Dissonant Whispers}
White------Radiant reduction, {@spell Sacred Flame},{@spell Guiding Bolt}

item.name: Coat of Arms
entries: While attuned to this you can speak the command word as an action to sprout a pair of spectral arms. The arms persist for an hour or until you dismiss them  (no action required).
You can do this 3 times per long rest.
While the arms exist, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) Checks made to grapple creatures and maintain grapples.
Climbing does not cost you extra movement
You ignore the loading property of weapons.
When make a melee attack as a bonus action on your turn, can make one additional attack as part of the same bonus action

item.name: Hookshot
entries: Hookshots are typically comprised of a pointed spearhead attached to a length of chain with a mechanism allowing them to be quickly deployed and retracted.
The hookshot can be used as a martial ranged weapon with a range 20/60 feet and the light property.
It deals piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6}+your Dexterity modifier on a hit.
After you make an attack with the hookshot, you can use a bonus action to retract it.
If the attack hit a creature or object, one of the following effects occurs. depending on the properties of the target:

items: If the target is a creature of your size or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled within 5 feet of you to an unoccupied space. The creature cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.

If the target is an object that is your size or larger made of wood or a similarly "soft" material or a creature of a larger size than you, you are pulled within 5 feet of it to an unoccupied space. At your DM's discretion, you may instead be able to climb onto the creature or object.

entries: Any other targets hit by the hookshot take damage as normal and cause no additional effects. Regardless of the target, the hookshot immediately detaches after it is finished retracting.

item.name: Cinderbane, Sword of Sinew and Steel
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic weapon.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack using the sword it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} damage that is either fire or necrotic (your choice)
When you deal necrotic damage with the sword you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.
When you deal fire damage with the sword, the target is ignited.
While ignited, the target takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC l0 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

item.name: Peculiar Coin
entries: A shiny coin that looks different from regular coins.

After failing an ability check or saving throw, but before knowing the outcome, time freezes, and whoever is in possession of this coin and concious may flip it. On a heads they automatically get a natural 20 for the check, and a natural 1 on a tails.
The coin has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 - 1} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Weave Cutter
entries: Imbued with powerful abjuration magic, this weapon suppresses any magic that would resist its damage. Additionally, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, you can cast {@spell Dispel Magic} as a 3rd level spell as part of your action. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Consume Magic
entries: You can cast {@spell Absorb Elements|XGE} at will as a 1st level spell, without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Witch Hunter
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic} at will, without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Lucky Seven
entries: (weapon any)

Everyone thinks they have a lucky item. A lucky copper piece, lucky dagger, lucky hat. But luck is much more fickle than that. Especially magical luck. See, luck is tangible and it truly exists in certain places.

This finely made weapon is embossed with golden four leafed clovers on its hilt. There is a strange weighting in the weapon's handle that will occasionally make a mediocre attack strike true, almost as if the weapon had a mind of its own.

entries.name: Lucky Seven
entries: This weapon scores a critical hit on a roll of 7 or 20

item.name: Yin & Yang
entries: Each of these rapiers is a counterpart to the other. The blade of one shines with a brilliant white metal while the other is made out of a jet black iron alloy. You attune to both swords as if it were one item.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic weapons.

entries.name: Yin
entries: Once per turn you may activate the sword to deal and extra {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with this magic weapon, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. Additionally, this weapon can be used to cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per long rest.

entries.name: Yang
entries: Once per turn you may activate the sword to deal and extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with this magic weapon, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. Additionally, this weapon can be used to cast the {@spell daylight} spell once per long rest.

item.name: Golden Beetle Pendant
entries: The Golden Beetle Pendant is stunning in its craftsmanship, with twisting golden arcs forming the curvature of its body and head and delicately set sapphires in its wings.

Multiple creatures can be attuned to the same pendant. Anyone attuned to the pendant is in its favor unless they do something directly destructive to nature or do something truly evil in its presence, at which time the attunement is lost.

entries.name: Lifegiver
entries: When anyone attuned to the pendant dies within 60 feet of it, the beetle unhooks itself from its chain and flies to them instantly, spreading its sapphire wings with a brilliant flash of green that returns them to life with 10 hit points.
Once this ability has been used, the beetle must spend an hour in direct moonlight to recharge this ability.

item.name: Boom Box
entries: This crystal cube contains a highly volatile substance that explodes upon impact.

You can use an action to throw the cube up to 60 feet. The cube explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the cube landed must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the point of impact.

item.name: Planar Mirror
entries: For many mages, looking into the vast realms that lie beyond the material planes is all but impossible. For some mages however, it is absolutely necessary. These mages have created items to help them in this process. Small, unassuming trinkets such as this mirror can act as a conduit to other planes, so that no creature can escape their purview.
The planar mirror, a very rare item, is a small black wooden hand mirror encircled with engravings of planar sigils.

While touching it, you can cast the {@spell scrying} spell (save DC 17) with it and can attempt to look at any location or being that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. When attempting to scry on a creature on a different plane than you, that creature has advantage on its saving throw.

Alternatively, you can peer into the mirror to view the destination of a plane shift spell, if you are within 30 feet of where the spell was cast and the spell was cast less than 1 minute ago. When using the mirror in this way the mirror reflects a shimmering portal and you learn the location it led to in general terms such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells.

item.name: Sungun
entries: This magical revolver has the Light property, with Reload 6 and Misfire 1. While attuned to this magical revolver, you gain a bonus to your attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency modifier rounded down when you attack with this magic weapon.

entries.name: High Noon
entries: At noon the empty chambers of the revolver are loaded with Deadeye bullets imbued with magical energy that ignore resistances and immunity to damage. Deadeye bullets deal radiant damage instead of piercing damage. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a Deadeye bullet the gun produces another Deadeye bullet.

entries.name: Fan The Hammer
entries: If the {@dice D20} roll for your initiative is a 15 or higher and your other hand is free, on your first turn you can forgo your movement and bonus action to make up to six attacks with this weapon with a single action. Once you use this feature it cannot be used again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Thousand Rat Shiv
entries: You gain +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Plague Bite
entries: When you damage a creature with this dagger the target takes an additional {@damage 2d8} poison damage and must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn. When a creature dies while {@condition poisoned} by this dagger or you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack made with this dagger, the body is consumed and a Swarm of Rats erupts from the corpse. Any time one of these swarms reduces a creature to 0 hit points, another Swarm of Rats takes that creature's place. All swarms summoned by this dagger and its effects remain for 10 minutes, after which they fade out of existence.

entries.name: Pack Rat
entries: At the start of your turn, you can use a free action to mentally command these swarms to move up to 30 feet in any direction and attack. As a bonus action or reaction(to being hit with a weapon attack), you can magically swap places with any swarm summoned by this dagger.

item.name: Brazen Ox Knuckles
entries: While wearing these magic bracers, your unarmed strikes gain +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls and you have advantage on attack rolls with unarmed strikes against creatures wearing heavy armor..

entries.name: Raging Ox
entries: If a creature makes a melee attack against you, you may use your reaction to make a melee attack against them.

entries.name: Burning Rage
entries: The Knuckles have a number of charges equal to your proficiency bonus. You may spend three charges to cast {@spell Heat Metal} from the Knuckles as a bonus action without concentration. You may spend additional charges to cast the spell at one level higher for each charge spent. If you target the Brazen Ox Knuckles with Heat Metal, your unarmed strikes deal an additional {@damage 2d8} fire damage plus {@damage 1d8} fire damage for each additional level of the spell. You do not take fire damage from casting Heat Metal on the Knuckles and you are resistant to cold damage for the duration of the spell. The Knuckles regain all expended charges after a long rest.

item.name: Desert Walker Shroud
entries: You have protection against the effects of the shifting temperatures of the desert. You can tolerate temperatures as high as 115 degrees Fahrenheit and as low as 0 degrees Fahrenheit without any additional protection. Creatures have disadvantage on perception or investigation checks to discover items or weapons hidden on your person. This poncho also has the abilities of a "{@item Cloak of Billowing|XGE}."

item.name: Snake Bite Whip
entries: You gain +{@hit 1} to hit on attack rolls made with this weapon.

entries.name: Viper Venom
entries: This weapon increases your attack range by an additional 5 ft. When you deal damage to a creature with this weapon, the snake head bites down and poisons the creature. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be Paralyzed for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Second Skin
entries: When you take damage from an attack, spell, or ability you may use your reaction to reduce that damage to 0, shedding the outer layer of your skin. Once you use this ability, it can't be used again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Snake Eye Stetson
entries: This hat has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} charges at dawn. You have advantage on insight checks while wearing this hat.

entries.name: Vaquero Grit
entries: While you wear this hat, if you would be {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} you can use your reaction to spend 1 charge to resist the effect. When a {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} condition is resisted this way, if you were the sole target of the effect, you may spend an additional charge to reflect the spell or ability back towards the creature who attempted to affect you.

item.name: Holly Jolly Jacket
entries: Wherever you go, winter and merriment follow close behind. While you are wearing this coat you are immune to cold damage and you can ignore difficult terrain and low temperatures caused by ice and snow.

entries.name: Down the Chimney
entries: As an action you and everything you are wearing and carrying, can meld with the coat. Until the end of your next turn you can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing and cannot be {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} by non magical means.

entries.name: Naughty or Nice
entries: If another creature within 30 feet of you rolls a 1 or 20 on a {@dice d20}, you can use your reaction to change the roll to the opposite number (1 becomes 20 and vice versa). If the roll was for an attack and is changed to a 20, it becomes a critical hit. Once you use this feature it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Father Winter
entries: As an action you become wreathed in frigid winter winds for 1 minute. Every step you take leaves icy frost in your wake, causing a 10 foot radius centered on you to become difficult terrain. Melee attacks you make deal a bonus {@damage 1d8} cold damage and the first time each turn you damage a creature with a melee attack while this feature is active, the target must make a DC 16 constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved until the start of your next turn. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Soloist's Harpblade
entries: Stand out from the competition. Show them how a true artist gets things done. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Showboat
entries: When you make an attack with this magic weapon you can use your bonus action to add one Bardic Inspiration die to the attack and damage rolls. You can wait until after you make your attack roll before choosing to use this feature, but you must decide before the DM says whether the attack roll succeeds or fails.

entries.name: Critique
entries: You gain access to the Vicious Mockery cantrip while attuned to this weapon. If you already have the Vicious Mockery cantrip you can alternatively choose another cantrip to gain access to. When you cast {@spell Vicious Mockery} while attuned to this weapon you can spend a Bardic Inspiration die to subtract the number rolled from the target's saving throw.

item.name: Wranglin' Rope
entries: As an action, you can use this item to make an attack roll against a creature within 15 feet of you. The attack uses your dexterity bonus and proficiency with a whip allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. If the attack hits, the creature is {@condition restrained} and you cannot use this feature again until the creature is no longer {@condition restrained}. You can use an action to pull the {@condition restrained} creature 10 feet towards you. You can use a bonus action to tighten the lasso dealing {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage or to release a creature {@condition restrained} by this item. The {@condition restrained} creature cannot be moved further than 15 feet from you while you hold the rope. The creature must use an action to make a DC 15 Strength (athletics) check to free itself from the rope. If the creature is more than one size class larger than you it is not considered {@condition restrained}, you cannot pull it towards you, and it has advantage on the strength check to free itself from the rope.

item.name: Sunder
entries: A crystalline weapon from times of old, broken but stronger than ever. This magic weapon has the versatile property and deals {@damage 1d6} damage instead when wielded with two hands.

entries.name: Brilliant Blade
entries: Once per turn when you take the attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks, expending a spell slot of your choice and infusing this weapon with destructive power. A wave of magical energy slashes forth from the broken blade in a wave that is 5-feet tall and extends from you in a cone with a size equal to 10 times the level of the expended spell slot. Each creature in the area must succeed on a dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 11 plus the level of the expended spell slot. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 1d10} force damage per level of the expended spell slot, or half as much on a successful save.

item.name: Soulmate Band
entries: The spirit of a jilted lover resides within this tarnished wedding ring. While attuned to this ring you have advantage against being {@condition charmed} as the spirit within the ring guards your heart for themselves.

entries.name: Till Death Do Us Part
entries: You can use your action to summon a Banshee from the ring to fight by your side for up to 10 minutes or until you dismiss it with a bonus action. The Banshee shares your initiative and moves after you, but cannot willingly move further than 30 feet from you. If you are further than 30 feet from the Banshee at the start of its turn, it attempts to move as close to you as possible before taking any other actions. The Banshee prioritizes attacking the closest creature to you or the most recent creature to deal damage to you. When you or the Banshee are reduced to 0 hit points the Banshee is sucked back into the ring. Once you use this feature it can't be used again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Once attuned to this ring, you cannot end your attunement to it. You hear the Banshee jealously whisper in your ear when you converse with other creatures. If you attempt to charm a creature or make a persuasion check, you must make a DC 12 wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature you attempt to charm makes their saving throw with advantage or you make your persuasion check with disadvantage. If a creature attempts to cast {@spell Remove Curse} on the ring, it fails and the Banshee emerges from the ring and attacks that creature until they are {@condition unconscious} or the Banshee is reduced to 0 hit points. To undo the curse, the Wedding portion of the Ceremony spell must be cast on you and the Banshee. Once you do, the Banshee passes on to the afterlife and this item loses all other features, and instead the ring provides a bonus +2 to your AC.

item.name: Titan
item.reqAttune: by a dwarf or earth genasi
entries: Carved from only the toughest earth and stone in the dwarven mountains, the mighty blade is found in the hands of warriors of similar sturdiness and connection to the earth. This weapon requires a Constitution score of 17 to wield. You gain a +1 bonus to AC while holding this weapon.

entries.name: Rolling Bash
entries: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a large or smaller creature before making a melee attack against it with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC Strength saving throw equal to 8 plus your proficiency bonus plus your Constitution bonus or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Mantle Skin
entries: If attuned to by a Dwarf or Earth Genasi, after each long rest your body is covered in a layer of protective stone and you gain 25 temporary hit points. While you have these hit points you gain a +1 bonus to AC and are immune to any spell or effect that would alter your form. Over the course of a long rest you can place at least 500 gold worth of gemstones into the empty slot of this weapon and the gemstones are consumed. If you do so, while the temporary hit points granted by this feature remain you gain an additional benefit based on the type of gemstone used:

entries.name: Ruby
entries: Fire resistance.

entries.name: Sapphire
entries: Cold resistance.

entries.name: Topaz
entries: Lightning resistance.

entries.name: Diamond
entries: Resistance to all magical damage.

item.name: Spellsnare Buckler
entries: Constructed from arcane shielding used in experiments, this shield grants its wielder the ability to absorb and even redirect magical energy.

entries.name: Catch
entries: This shield has a number of charges equal to 3 + your proficiency bonus. When a creature within 10 feet of you becomes the target of a spell, you can use your reaction to spend 1 or more charges to attempt to snare it. If the number of charges spent is equal to or exceeds the spell level, the spell's effect is countered as it is absorbed into the shield. If the number of charges spent is less than the level of the spell, the spell targets you instead and is not absorbed. The shield can have only one spell absorbed at a time. At the end of your turn, if a spell is absorbed by the shield, you must make an Intelligence saving throw to attempt to contain it. The DC is equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a failure, the shield is destroyed as it explodes in a 20ft sphere around you, dealing {@damage 1d6} force damage for each level of the spell to each creature in the area.

entries.name: Release
entries: While a spell is absorbed by the shield, you can spend an action to release it. The spell is cast as though the original spellcaster had done so using the original DC and dice rolled, but you may choose a new target within the spell's range.

item.name: Saint's Scripture
entries: The word of the Dawn Saint alone can be a tool for delivering healing and grace to the sick and needy. If you are a Cleric or Paladin, you can use this tome as a holy symbol, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls while you hold it.

entries.name: Compassion
entries: This item has a number of charges equal to your proficiency modifier and regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} charges daily at dawn. You can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells: Detect Good and Evil, {@spell Detect Poison and Disease} (1 charge), {@spell Cure Wounds}, {@spell Sanctuary}, (2 charges), {@spell Mass Healing Word}, {@spell Beacon of Hope} (3 charges).
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Charisma or Wisdom.

entries.name: Generosity
entries: When you heal a creature while holding this item, roll one additional die of the same type and add the result to the number of hit points healed.

entries.name: Self-Sacrifice
entries: When you roll a death saving throw, you can choose to fail your save and cause another creature within 20 feet of you to regain a number of hit points equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Charisma bonus. If you regain consciousness, you gain a point of {@condition exhaustion}. Once you use this ability, it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Butterfly
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to damage and attack rolls you make with this magic weapon. This item has a number of charges equal to your proficiency modifier and regains all charges after a long rest. When thrown this dagger flies back, returning to your hand.

entries.name: Feather
entries: You can cast the {@spell Feather Fall} spell at will targeting only yourself.

entries.name: Flitter
entries: As a bonus action you can spend a charge to gain a temporary fly speed equal to your movement speed +10 until the end of your next turn. Until this feature ends, opportunity attacks are made against you with disadvantage. When the feature ends you fall if still aloft, unless you can stop the fall.

entries.name: Flurry
entries: When you make an attack with this magic weapon with advantage, you can spend a charge to instead make an additional weapon attack against that target as part of the same attack action.

item.name: Starstep Diadem
entries: A crown fashioned to hold the fossilized fetal remains of a creature that fell from the stars. It allows the wearer to interact with the mysterious shifting of space across the universe. While attuned to this item, you can sense when a creature within 100 feet of you is teleporting (e.g. Misty Step, Dimension Door, Planeshift, etc.). This item has 2 charges and regains all charges daily at dusk.

entries.name: Cosmic Passenger
entries: When a creature within 100 feet of you teleports, you can use your reaction to spend a charge and teleport alongside them, appearing in an empty space within 5 feet of the creature.

entries.name: Universal Eye
