entries: When a creature within 100 feet of you teleports, for the next minute you can use this item to cast the {@spell Scrying} spell on that target, making its wisdom save with disadvantage. The base Spell Save DC is 10 unless yours is higher. Once you use this feature it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Scholar Beater Belt
entries: An inconspicuous piece of clothing that turns a warrior into every mage's worst nightmare.

entries.name: Your Best Shot
entries: This item has a pool of 50 temporary hit points that replenishes after you finish a long rest. You can use an action to activate this belt, causing a set of spectral armor to engulf your body for 1 minute or until you use a bonus action to dismiss the armor. You gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the number left in the pool. If any of these temporary hit points remain when the ability ends, you lose them and they are stored in the pool up to a maximum of 50. While you have these temporary hit points you have a +1 bonus to your AC and have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.Once you use this ability it can't be used again until you finish a short rest.

item.name: Giant's Share Frying Pan
entries: This runed cast-iron frying pan can change size at will, allowing you to cook for larger groups of adventurers without breaking a sweat. If you take the dodge action you can shield yourself with this pan and gain a +1 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Morphing Metal
entries: You can use a bonus action to cause the pan to enlarge in size. While enlarged, this weapon uses the properties of a {@item greatclub|PHB} and your movement speed is reduced by 5. If you take the dodge action while in greatclub form, this pan grants a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn. When preparing food, you can serve three times the number of people you can normally serve. You can use a bonus action to revert the pan to its regular size.

entries.name: Heavy Retention
entries: If exposed to a source of fire, this pan immediately warms and retains the heat for an hour. Food can be cooked without a flame and the weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4} fire damage while heat is retained this way.

item.name: Raiment of the Final Dawn
entries: Radiant as the sun, pure as the sky, strong as the earth. While wearing this coat you have advantage against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} and you can understand and speak Celestial. This item can store up to 3 charges. When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of you, this item gains a charge. If the creature was an undead or fiend this item gains 2 charges instead.

entries.name: Consecration
entries: From the blood of the infernal that stains this holy vestment, light shines forth. You can use an action to activate this feature, causing you to become a holy avatar of battle. While this feature is active, at the start of each of your turns you regain an amount of hit points equal to 1+ your constitution modifier, you have resistance to fire and necrotic damage, and melee attacks you make deal an additional {@damage 2d4} radiant damage. At the end of each of your turns, the raiment loses a charge until it has no charges remaining, at which point this feature is no longer active. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Corruption
entries: If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of you while this item has 3 charges, at the start of your next turn you must succeed on a DC 18 wisdom saving throw. On a failed save you move directly towards the nearest creature to you and use the attack action against that creature. You can choose whether or not to use your extra attack feature for this manic attack. If there is more than one possible target, roll to randomly determine the target. You then regain control for the remainder of your turn. If you are under an effect that prevents you from concentrating (such as the barbarian's Rage feature), you automatically fail this saving throw.

item.name: The Hand of Treachery
entries: Forged from terrible deeds for a noble cause, a weapon with a dubious birth now thirsts for its kind. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with this magic weapon. This weapon has 3 charges and regains all charges daily at dusk.

entries.name: Coagulate
entries: If a Vampire is damaged by this weapon, at the start of its next turn its Regeneration feature causes it to regain {@dice 1d20} hit points instead.

entries.name: Kindred Bloodhunt
entries: As a bonus action you can choose to designate one Vampire you can see within 60 feet as the target of this feature. If you rest this weapon in your palm it points in the direction of the designated creature so long as you are on the same plane as it. As long as the target is within 60 feet of you, when it attempts to use either its Charm or Children of the Night action and you can see them, you can use your reaction to spend a charge, forcing the target to succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save this weapon's peculiar powers cause the feature to fail. Any uses of the failed ability are expended as though it were countered. This benefit lasts until the target dies or you designate a new creature as the target of this feature.

item.name: The Watcher's Eyes
entries: It's always better to have more eyes watching your back. You gain a +1 bonus to damage and attack rolls you make with this magic weapon. When you speak the command word, the weapon's eyes glow with a menacing light, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet that pierces even magical darkness. This weapon has 3 charges and regains all charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Such Sights to Show
entries: You can spend a charge to hold this weapon up to the face of a creature within 5 feet of you that can see the light and hypnotize it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or become affected by your choice of the Command, Charm Person or Dissonant Whispers spell. A creature that cannot normally see (such as a blind creature or a creature with no eyes) is immune to this feature.

entries.name: Nowhere to Hide
entries: When you cast the {@spell Scrying} spell you can spend a charge to cause the target to make their save with disadvantage. While you are scrying you can spend a charge to change the type of vision you experience to {@sense darkvision}, X-ray vision, or seeing the presence of magic as if affected by the Detect Magic spell. While this weapon has at least 1 charge you also become aware if you or a friendly creature within 30 feet of you is being scryed upon and can see any scrying sensor within 30 feet of you.

item.name: Quickstep Chapsatcher's Eyes
entries: Leather chaps with a golden buckle and tooled designs of alchemical nature. You gain a +2 bonus to your initiative so long as you are not surprised. When you roll a 1 on your initiative roll, you may reroll the die. You must use the new roll.

item.name: Dayspring Longbow
entries: The only things that shine brighter than this embellished weapon are the arrows of sunlight it conjures to battle the infernal. This bow doesn't require ammunition, automatically creating arrows of pure sunlight when the bowstrings are drawn back. Ranged attacks you make with these arrows deal radiant damage instead of the weapon's normal damage. An arrow created by this weapon disappears after it hits or misses a target.

entries.name: Piercing Light
entries: This weapon has 3 charges and regains all charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can spend a charge to fire a light arrow at a point within 100 feet, casting the Daylight spell at that point.

entries.name: Sun Shower
entries: You can spend an action to fire an arrow into the air and choose a point within 150 feet of you. Each creature in a 40-foot radius, 20-foot high cylinder under that point must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw as a barrage of light arrows shower the area. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this feature, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Shard of the Apex
entries: Often, the terrible designs of nature itself can prove inspirational to the art of combat. You gain a +3 bonus to damage and attack rolls you make with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Primal Presence
entries: When you enter your rage, you summon the terror of the ancient hunter into your body. You force each creature within 30 feet of you to succeed on a DC 16 wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Rip and Tear
entries: When you score a critical hit against a creature with this weapon, the target begins to bleed profusely and loses {@dice 2d6} hitpoints at the start of each of its turns. If you score a critical hit on the same creature while it is affected by this feature, the hitpoint loss increases by {@dice 2d6}. Any creature can attempt to stop the bleeding by succeeding on a DC 14 medicine check. Constructs, undead and any other creatures that do not bleed are immune to this feature.

entries.name: Bring it Down
entries: The first time each turn you damage a large or smaller creature with this weapon you can force the target to make a contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. Small and tiny creatures make this check with disadvantage. If you succeed, you yank the creature by the hooked blade of this weapon and knock it {@condition prone}.

item.name: Hag's Finger
entries: A {@condition petrified} finger of a Hag, perhaps given as a gift, or perhaps given as a hex. While using this wand as an arcane focus, you gain a bonus +1 to spell attack rolls. This wand has two charges and regains all expended charges at dusk.

entries.name: Cruel Magicks
entries: You can spend a charge to cast the {@spell Bestow Curse} spell without expending a spell slot. If you cast the {@spell Bestow Curse} spell while attuned to this item it does not require spell components and you can spend a number of spell slots to increase the spell level cast by that amount of levels.

entries.name: Malicious Sustenance
entries: You can spend an action to consume the Hag's Finger, swallowing it whole. You transform into an Annis Hag for up to 10 minutes as though affected by the {@spell True Polymorph} spell without requiring concentration. When you revert back to your normal form, a finger drops from your hand to the ground and becomes a new Hag's Finger. Once you use this feature, it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If you use the Malicious Sustenance feature, you cannot unnattune from the wand. At the end of each long rest you must roll a {@dice D20}. On a 10 or lower, features of an Annis Hag begin to appear on your person, such as hunched shoulders, unappealing grey skin, and a stench of death lingering about you. Each time you roll a 10 or lower the effects become more severe until you fail three times, at which point others perceive you as a Hag. A Greater Restoration or Remove Curse spell mitigates the effects of the curse for up to 1 hour. To undo the curse you must find an Annis Hag and present it with this wand to remove the effects, as only an Annis Hag understands the intricacies of their magic. If they do so, this item loses the Malicious Sustenance feature and you revert to your original form.

item.name: Kinetically Augmented Ballistic Overkill Obliteration Machine
entries: The line between genius as insanity is a blurry one. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon can hold up to 5 charges. You can cast a spell that deals fire damage into the engine of this weapon. The spell has no effect and this weapon gains a number of charges equal to the level of the spell slot used. You can instead insert a Red Corundum {@item Elemental Gem} into the engine of this weapon. As long as the engine holds the gem inside it, the weapon regains all charges after a long rest.

entries.name: Booster Blade
entries: As a bonus action you can spend a charge to fire up the engine of this weapon and supercharge your attacks. Until the end of your turn this weapon gains the thrown property (Range 20/120) and your attacks are made with advantage dealing an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage on a hit. After each attack you make, you must succeed on a Strength saving throw where the DC is equal to 13 plus the number of attacks you have made this turn. On a failed save you lose your grip on this weapon as the rocket continues to fire and it flies a number of feet equal to 10 times the number of attacks you have made this turn in a random direction or until it hits a structure. Any creature in the weapon's path must make a Dexterity saving throw where the DC is equal to 13 plus the number of attacks made this turn or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Luxus Voucher
entries: The finest hospitality in this, or any plane.

entries.name: Welcome
entries: This single-use voucher grants you one visit to The Luxus, a lavish hotel located in the Astral Plane. When you tear the ticket, a gorgeous mahogany door appears in front of you as though instantly casting the Magnificent Mansion spell. The door disappears after it has been closed. The interior appears as a luxurious hotel decorated in gold. All other aspects of the spell are subject to your wishes.

entries.name: Rest and Relaxation
entries: While in the hotel a creature can enter the hotel spa to undergo treatments to cure them of diseases, conditions, and curses that could be undone by the Greater Restoration or Remove Curse spells.

entries.name: Chauffeur
entries: When a creature leaves the hotel it can choose to teleport to a place that it knows on the plane that the creature is from. If a creature has not left the hotel after 24 hours they reappear at an unoccupied space near where the ticket was torn.

item.name: Shade, the Coffin Nail
entries: While sheathed, this weapon is indistinguishable from an ordinary cane. A creature must succeed on a DC 16 investigation check to discern its true nature. This weapon has a number of charges equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded down and regains all charges daily at dusk.

entries.name: Shadow Tag
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can spend a charge to forgo the damage and instead target the creature's shadow with this magic weapon. If you do, the target becomes {@condition restrained} while this sword is pinning its shadow. The creature makes a DC 15 Charisma Saving throw at the end of its turns to break free.

While this ability is active you cannot make attacks with this weapon and the ability ends if you let go of the weapon or it is removed from the ground. You can remove the blade from a shadow it is pinning as a free action, freeing the creature from being {@condition restrained}. This feature cannot be used if there is no light to cast the target's shadow.

item.name: Escoffier, the Peerless Edge
entries: This pristine 240 mm chef's knife of celestial make grants its wielder the ability of a master chef. While you are attuned to this item, it gains the following features:

entries.name: Grand Chef
entries: You have advantage on any ability checks that involve food preparation including but not limited to carving creatures, memorizing a complicated recipe, making a dish more presentable, etc. Food preparation takes half as long while you are attuned to this knife.

entries.name: Refined Blade
entries: This knife can only carve through non-magical, inanimate materials. Regardless of the material's properties, the knife glides through with little resistance.

item.name: The Locker Key
entries: This crude-looking blade banishes unfortunate souls to the crushing depths far below the ocean surface to meet their painful end.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The scimitar grants the following benefits in its dormant state:
You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon has 3 charges and regains all charges daily at dusk.

entries.name: To the Locker
entries: When you hit a creature, you can spend a charge to have this weapon deal an additional {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to below 30 hit points, the creature must make a charisma saving throw. The DC is equal to 10 + your proficiency bonus + your charisma bonus. On a failed save the creature is teleported to The Locker, a demiplane resembling a prison at the bottom of the ocean. At the start of the creature's turns it takes {@damage 5d10} force damage from the crushing pressure of the water. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is crushed into pulp and does not return, after which this weapon regains a charge. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its own turns, ending the effect on itself on a success and reappearing in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. The soul of a creature that dies is trapped in The Locker and cannot be restored except by a wish spell.

entries.name: Curse
entries: The Pull of the Sea. This blade is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you cannot unattune from this weapon except by an effect such as the remove curse spell. If your attunement ends, the item returns to its dormant state as though no creatures had died from its abilities. If a humanoid creature has not been killed by the To The Locker ability within one week of the last, on each subsequent day you must roll one of your hit dice. Your hit point maximum is reduced by that amount as the blade begins to siphon your soul. Your hit point maximum is reduced this way until you kill a humanoid creature with the To The Locker feature. If your hit point maximum is reduced to zero, you die and your soul is transported and trapped in the depths of The Locker.
When 25 humanoid creatures have died using the To The Locker feature, this weapon reaches its awakened form.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: The scimitar grants the following benefits in its awakened state:
The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
To The Locker now deals {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage and the hit point threshold is increased to 40 hit points.

entries.name: Gaze into the Abyss
entries: Your mind has been blessed by the depths in ways yet incomprehensible. If you succeed on a wisdom or charisma saving throw the creature whose ability or spell caused you to make a saving throw subtracts half your charisma modifier from the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.
When 50 humanoid creatures have died using the To The Locker feature, this weapon reaches its exalted form.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The scimitar grants the following benefits in its exalted state:
The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
To The Locker now deals {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage and the hit point threshold is increased to 50 hit points.

Gaze into the Abyss now causes the creature whose ability or spell caused you to make a saving throw to subtract your charisma modifier from the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Life is Cruel
entries: Whenever you score a critical hit against a creature, you may use the To The Locker ability against the target without expending a charge.

item.name: Antique Requiem Box
entries: Sweet music of a time long past is preserved in metal within this box. This item has 2 charges and regains all charges at dusk.

entries.name: Eerie Lullaby
entries: You can use an action to spend a charge and crank this music box to cast the {@spell Sleep} spell centered on the box. The music can be heard up to 40 feet but only affects creatures within 20 feet of this Item. If you cast the {@spell Sleep} spell while attuned to this item it does not require spell components, and you can spend a number of charges to add {@dice 2d8} to the amount of hit points of creatures you can affect for each charge. Each creature affected by this spell falls {@condition unconscious} as long as you spend an action to crank the music box, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

entries.name: Discordant Nightmare
entries: You can reverse the melody of the box for one minute to instill your prey with fiendish nightmares. If you do, {@condition unconscious} creatures within 20 feet of you must make a wisdom saving throw. The DC is 15 or your own spell save DC, whichever is higher. On a failed save, the frightful tune spawns a nightmare that lasts the duration of the target's sleep and prevents the target from gaining any benefit from that rest. In addition, when the affected creatures awaken, they take {@damage 3d6} psychic damage. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curse
entries: After using the Discordant Nightmare feature, you cannot sleep except by magical means, as the nightmares within the box keep you awake. To break the curse you must travel to the Astral Plane and play the Discordant Nightmare melody for one hour, which attracts the denizens of the plane. After playing the music box this way, the curse is broken, the living nightmares leave the box, and it loses the Discordant Nightmare feature.

item.name: Cobalt Dueling Boots
entries: While wearing these boots you gain a +2 bonus to dexterity for a maximum of 20.

entries.name: One Step Ahead
entries: When a creature makes a melee attack against you or forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make one weapon attack against it. You must make this attack immediately before the creature's attack is rolled or making the saving throw. If your attack hits, the creature makes their attack with disadvantage or you make your saving throw with advantage. You can use this feature twice before finishing a short or long rest.

entries.name: Lapin Legs
entries: Your walking speed increases by 10 ft. while attuned to this weapon. Twice per long rest you may cast {@spell Jump} on yourself as a bonus action.

entries.name: Lucky Rabbit
entries: If you hit a creature with the Jack Rabbit Bow, you may make another attack immediately against that same creature as a free action. Repeat this free action until your attack roll is equal to or lower than a previous result, or you score a critical hit. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, roll all of the attack's damage dice three times instead of twice.

item.name: Crimson Longhorn
entries: This bottle contains a fizzy red liquid that is popular amongst students of magic when relaxing, providing a pleasant buzz alongside its magical benefits. When you drink this potion, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls for up to 10 minutes. The duration extends for an additional 10 minutes per Crimson {@item Longhorn|SCAG} consumed within the past hour. Each time you drink a bottle of Crimson {@item Longhorn|SCAG}, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. The DC is equal to 9 + the number of Crimson Longhorns consumed within the past hour. On a failure or when the effects end, you have disadvantage on Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws for {@dice 1d4} hours for each bottle consumed. If you fail the saving throw by 5 or more, you fall {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 1d4} hours. These effects can only be removed early by Protection from Poison, Greater Restoration or similar spells or abilities.

item.name: Mistle-Bolts
entries: Overconfidence ends the careers of more adventurers than even the mightiest beasts.

entries.name: Revoke Gifts
entries: When you fire this ammunition, if you hit a creature that is under a magical effect that makes it resistant or immune to any damage type, such as the {@spell Invulnerability} spell or a {@item Potion of Resistance}, the target takes no damage and the effect granting the target their resistance or invulnerability ends. If the creature has a resistance or immunity granted by an item such as the {@item Armor of Resistance}, the item's effect becomes inactive for 1 minute.

item.name: Grand Wolf's Hide
entries: While attuned to this magic pelt, if your physical form would be altered by lycanthropy or a spell or ability (Wild Shape, Polymorph, Enlarge/Reduce, Form of the Beast, etc.), this item merges into your body. While transformed you retain the ability to speak in languages you know (you still cannot cast spells in wildshape unless you gained he ability to do so) and the form you take gains the following additional traits:

entries.name: Lupine Senses
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks involving sight, hearing, and smell, and advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track a creature. If your form would already have advantage on such checks you gain an additional +2 bonus to them instead.

entries.name: Lycan Legs
entries: You are considered to be under the effect of the Jump spell while transformed.

entries.name: Ancestral Hide
entries: You gain 10 temporary hit points at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point as a mass of thick furred hide forms to cover your body. If you take damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of your next turn.

item.name: Raggedy Marionette
entries: Ever watching. Ever present. Ever loving. A discarded doll of unknown origin with a hollow gaze.

entries.name: My Favorite
entries: You can place a piece of a creature (a lock of hair, a scale, etc) into the mouth of this doll to bring it to life. While animated, the doll has 10 hit points,16 AC, and a movement speed of 40 feet, and if it drops to 0 hit points it reverts back to a nonmagical doll. It becomes aware of the target's location at all times if it is on the same plane of existence and begins to follow the creature at every waking moment. The doll keeps within visual distance of the creature at all times, and if perceived, adopts the False Appearance feature akin to a Mimic. As an action, you can see through the doll's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

entries.name: Survival Instinct
entries: If the doll feels it is in danger or is targeted by a spell akin to the Protection from Good and Evil spell which turns it inanimate, it attempts to return to you. It is aware of your location at all times and does not stop until it finds you, at which point it leaps into your arms and becomes inanimate until you present it with another creature's material.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If the Raggedy Marionette is killed but it's body is not destroyed, after 24 hours it rises as a Carrionette and seeks revenge upon you. It is aware of your location at all times if it is on the same plane of existence as you and seeks to Soul Swap with you. When you are sleeping, you see through the Carrionette's eyes as it endeavors to reach you and exact its revenge. To undo the curse a Protection from Good and Evil spell must be cast on the Carrionette which causes it to revert to its original form as a Raggedy Marionette or the Carionette must be destroyed completely. If the Carionette is reduced to 0 hit points but not destroyed, after 24 hours it rises again and continues to pursue you.

item.name: Boar's Head Aegis
entries: You gain an additional +1 AC and take half damage from piercing attacks while holding this shield. This shield has 6 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Goring Rush
entries: You may expend 2 of the shield's charges to barrel forward up to your movement speed + 10 feet in a straight line. Each creature in the line takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 3d6} + half your Strength modifier rounded down and must make a DC 15 strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is knocked {@condition prone} and must make a DC 15 wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Boar's Hide
entries: When you are damaged by a non-magical weapon or ammunition, you can use your reaction to spend a charge and reduce the damage by {@dice 1d6} + your constitution modifier.

item.name: Censer of Zeal
entries: This magic weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d8} damage to fiends. While attuned to this weapon, you are proficient with it and it is considered a monk weapon for you.

entries.name: Zealous Vapours
entries: You create a 10 foot radius cloud of incense centered on you that invigorates your allies and debilitates your foes for 10 minutes. Whenever you or a friendly creature within the radius make an attack roll or saving throw they can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack or saving throw.

Whenever a hostile creature within the radius makes an attack roll or a saving throw the creature must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw. You must maintain concentration on this feature as though concentrating on a spell as you chant a hymn to maintain the effect for a maximum of 10 minutes.
You must complete a 1 hour ritual to refresh the incense after using this feature.

item.name: Crescent Dragon Horn
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.

entries.name: Dragon's Ascension
entries: You may use an action to cast {@spell Call Lightning} at 5th level without expending a spell slot. The spell save DC is 16 unless your spell save DC is higher. You share vision with the storm and can close your eyes to see through the storm as though you were in its space for the duration of the spell. You are aware of all creatures in a 60 foot radius around you, even those behind cover. Once you use this ability, it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Storm Strider
entries: When you target a point with {@spell Call Lightning} you may spend a bonus action to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that targeted point. Each creature within 10 feet of that space must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} Thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

item.name: Band of Brawn
entries: Sometimes the simplest solutions are the best.

entries.name: Brawn Over Brains
entries: You can use a bonus action to tap the gem of this ring. Your primary spellcasting ability score is reduced by 5 and you gain a +5 bonus to your Strength for 1 minute. When this ability ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

item.name: Chef's Eye Apron
entries: An apron adorned with dwarven runes meant to enhance one's cooking ability. While wearing this magic apron, you become proficient with {@item Cook's Utensils|PHB}. If you are already proficient with {@item Cook's Utensils|PHB} you gain expertise with {@item Cook's Utensils|PHB}.

entries.name: Discerning Eye
entries: You can spend a minute to identify the status of a potential ingredient, such as checking if something is poisonous to consume. You can also spend a minute observing a creature to check their health to see if they are diseased, undead, or dying.

item.name: Aegis of the Duplicant
entries: Who better to depend on in battle than yourself? This mirror shield has a number of charges equal to your proficiency modifier. In order for this item to regain charges, you must stare into the mirror during a long rest, which prevents you from gaining any benefits from that rest. After doing so, this item regains all charges.

entries.name: Visage of Violence
entries: You can use a bonus action to spend a charge and aim this mirror at a creature you can see within 60 feet. Until the end of your turn you can make melee attacks against that target as though you were in a space adjacent to it as the wounds appear on their body from afar. Creatures who can see the mirror witness a reflection of you attacking the target's image within the mirror.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If you use the Visage of Violence feature, you cannot unattune from the shield. If this item has no charges remaining or does not have all of its charges for 3 consecutive days, every following long rest you must roll a {@dice D20}. On a 1, your soul is teleported to the demiplane inside the mirror where it is trapped and the entity from the mirror possesses your physical body. While in this state your soul does not require anything to live, and must watch the events of the world through the face of the mirror and their image is used for the Visage of Violence ability. This effect can be undone by the use of the Greater Restoration or Wish spell. The creature has all of your memories and acts as you would but secretly seeks to destroy the mirror with you in it. The mirror can be destroyed by the use of the Remove Curse spell followed by dealing 35 damage to the mirror with the Shatter spell within 1 minute.

entries.name: Apex Predator
entries: While you hold this weapon, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to an additional 60 ft and you have advantage on stealth checks. You gain an additional bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon equal to your dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Tiger's Claws
entries: This magic greataxe has a number of charges equal to your proficiency modifier and regains all expended charges at dawn. You can spend a charge to send a slash of energy out from the axe heads. Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A creature tales {@damage 4d6} slashing damage on a failed save and is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn. A creature that succeeds takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

item.name: Battle-Ready Hook
entries: A prosthetic hook augmented for use in combat.

This item attaches to the end of your arm and replaces a lost limb. You can detach or reattach it as an action and it can't be removed against your will. While attached, you can use the bladed end of the hook to attack as though it were a dagger without the thrown property.

entries.name: Swordcatcher
entries: You can use your reaction when you are hit by a melee weapon attack to attempt to catch the weapon and reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus. If you reduce the damage to 0, the creature must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature drops the weapon it used to attack you if it is capable of doing so.

item.name: Hound Master Chakram
entries: You gain +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon and it returns to your hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack. This weapon deals slashing damage instead of the usual bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hunting Call
entries: If you damage a creature with this weapon, you may use your bonus action to summon a spectral Hound familiar to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. Use the Direwolf stat block for the summoned creatures. These familiars are added to the initiative order immediately after you, following your commands. Your familiars may only attack opponents you have damaged with this weapon, and you may summon up to three at a time. If you attempt to summon more than three familiars, the earliest to have been summoned is dismissed. If there are no viable targets at the start of the familiar's turns, they all vanish and must be summoned again.

entries.name: Hound's Instincts
entries: You gain an additional +1 bonus to attack rolls when attacking targets that are within 5 feet of a Hound familiar. If a creature is within 5 feet of all three Hound familiars you gain advantage on attack rolls made against that target.

item.name: Rooster Wing Javelin
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Furious Pecking
entries: If you hit a creature with a ranged attack with the Rooster Wing Javelin, you may use a bonus action to speak the command word. At the start of each of your turns the Javelin homes in on the same target, making a free attack against them (no action required). The javelin uses your attack roll and ability score modifier to damage rolls. This effect persists until you spend a bonus action to recall the Javelin or the creature dies, at which point the Javelin flies 60 feet back to you on each turn until it returns to your hand. If you have no hands free, it hovers within 5 feet of you until you grasp it. This effect also ends if you are knocked {@condition unconscious}. The targeted creature may spend their reaction to try and catch the javelin on their turn by making an DC 18 dexterity check, which ends the effect on a success.

entries.name: Soaring Rooster
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you gain the ability to fly while holding or standing on top of the Javelin. Your fly speed is equivalent to your movement speed + 10 feet.

item.name: Top Hat of Companionship
entries: A fashionable piece of clothing that can bring companionship wherever you go.

entries.name: Make a Friend
entries: You can place this hat atop a mound of material no larger than 3 cubic feet. For the next hour, the substance is imbued with limited sentience and animation akin to the Speak with Plants spell. Depending on the material (such as a mound of rocks or snowman) your companion can move alongside you at a speed of 30 movement. If the animated companion moves further than 100 feet from you, the hat is removed, or the material is destroyed the effect ends. Once you use this feature it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Sheets of Sudden Brilliance
entries: For the dullards and indolent amongst students. While holding this piece of parchment, you can spend a minute focusing on a sheet of paper that you can see within 30 feet of you. If you do so, all writing and markings on the side of the paper you can see are copied onto this item. If the item you are focusing on is larger than this average sized sheet of paper, the ability manages to copy as much as can fit onto this sheet. After you do so, this item loses all magical properties.

item.name: Luminous Nose
entries: A charming toy inspired by a strangely cruel children's folk tale.

When placed on the end of a creature's nose this item glows with a red hue and cannot be removed for 10 minutes or until the creature is knocked {@condition unconscious}. While attached this way, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20-feet and the creature gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed. This light persists even if you are {@condition invisible} and pierces magical darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower. Completely covering the orb with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the light. The effect ends after 10 minutes and the creature falls if still aloft unless it can stop the fall. Once you use this feature it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Locked and Loaded
entries: You may spend a bonus action to wave a ranged weapon over the bandolier to reload it. This item creates a full round of quicksilver copies of ammunition of the respective weapon. These quicksilver bullets deal the same damage as normal ammunition and are considered magical and silvered. Ammunition formed with this ability cannot jam or cause your weapon to misfire. You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

item.name: Monkey Paw Flail
entries: You gain a bonus to attack rolls equal to half your dexterity bonus rounded down.

entries.name: Thousand Palms
entries: This weapon increases your attack range by an additional 10 feet. When you make an attack with this weapon, you choose whether it deals bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage as the flail changes form according to your choice.

entries.name: Grasping Monkey
entries: If you hit a large or smaller creature with the Flail, you can negate any damage inflicted and instead force the creature to make a contested {@skill Athletics} (Strength) or {@skill Acrobatics} (Dexterity) check. If you win the contest, you can either knock it {@condition prone}, grapple it, or force it to drop an item it is holding. Instead of making an attack you can manipulate this weapon to retrieve an item within range and bring it towards you as long as it does not weigh more than a number of pounds equal to 10 + your strength modifier and you have an open hand.

item.name: Stallion Kick Staff
entries: This weapon has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Seismic Hoof
entries: If you damage a creature with this weapon, you may expend up to 3 charges to force the target to make a strength saving throw. The DC is equal to 10 + your strength modifier. On a failed save the creature flies 10 x {@dice 1d4} feet backwards per charge and is knocked {@condition prone}. A creature who gets pushed into something, such as another creature or a wall also takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet they are pushed back before making impact.

entries.name: Horse Power
entries: You may treat a short rest like a long rest while attuned to this weapon. One hour after you use this ability you gain two points of {@condition exhaustion}. Points of {@condition exhaustion} gained from this ability cannot be removed by any means other than a long rest or by the use of the Wish spell.

item.name: Goat's Horn Hammer
entries: This weapon has 2 charges and regains all charges daily at dawn. It functions as a {@item musical instrument|PHB} which you are proficient with if you are proficient with horns.

entries.name: Adamant Goat
entries: You cannot be {@condition stunned} or knocked {@condition prone} while attuned to this weapon.

entries.name: Herd's Anthem
entries: You can spend a charge to blow into the horn atop this hammer and rally your companions. You and all allies within 30 feet of you may roll one hit die, add their constitution modifier, and gain that many temporary hit points. If an ally affected by this ability is {@condition stunned}, {@condition charmed}, or {@condition frightened}, that condition ends. Until the start of your next turn each ally gains advantage on the next attack they make.

item.name: Blade of Sanctuary
entries: The most holy of weapons, granted only to the most righteous to lead the way to salvation. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. If you are within 30 feet of an undead or fiend, you gain an additional +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

entries.name: Blessed Light
entries: You can cause the sword to emit a holy light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet for 10 minutes. The light is sunlight and while it shines, the blade deals an additional damage die as radiant damage. You must maintain concentration on this feature as though concentrating on a spell. While the light is active you and allied creatures within 15 feet of you have a +1 bonus to AC and advantage on all saving throws other than your own Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. Once you use this feature, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Righteousness
entries: If an allied creature is reduced to 0 hit points within 10 feet of you, attacks you make until the end of your next turn are made with advantage.

item.name: Merry-Maker Ball
entries: A lovely souvenir that foretells a frosty evening. You can change the illusory image on the inside of the ball to whatever structure you wish, but snow is always falling. This ball is always ice cold to the touch.

entries.name: Snow Day
entries: You can spend an action to swirl this ornament around in your palm to cast the {@spell Sleet Storm} spell centered on you. Each turn you use a bonus action to continue to swirl this item in your hand, the radius of the spell increases by 5 feet up to a maximum of 60 feet. The spell is centered on you and the radius moves with you. You ignore the effects and difficult terrain of this spell. This effect ends after a minute or if you do not spend a bonus to action to swirl the item in your hand. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Blizzard
entries: As an action you can throw this item at a point within 60 ft. Upon contact the orb shatters, destroying it and casting the Ice Storm spell centered on that point.

item.name: Cantrip Blaster
entries: Also known as Arcane Blasters, these curved wood and metal wands are magically enchanted to focus and amplify blasts of arcane energy.

In the hands of a non-spellcaster the cantrip blaster is mechanically considered a martial ranged weapon with Reload 6 and Misfire 2 that deals {@damage 1d10} force damage with a range of 80/320. Proficiency in either firearms or hand crossbow is sufficient for wielding this weapon. On a misfire you suffer {@damage 1d10} force damage and the weapon cannot be used again until the end of your next turn. The reload period is considered an arcane recharge period since the wand does not require ammunition.
In addition, you gain a bonus to your attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency modifier rounded down.
If you are a spellcaster you can use this wand as an arcane focus and unlock these additional features when casting cantrips:
If you are an Artificer (Artillerist) you can carve sigils into the wand to make it your Arcane Firearm.
You gain a bonus to your ranged spell attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency modifier rounded down.

entries.name: Beam Splitter
entries: When you attack with the wand you can split the damage dice of cantrips with level dependent damage increases into individual beams. The number of beams equal the number of damage dice available and each beam does one die of damage. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam. If the dice roll of any beam attack is less than or equal to 2, the wand misfires and can't be used again until the end of your next turn

entries.name: Followup Shot
entries: If you use your action to cast a spell that is not focused through the wand, you can use your bonus action to fire one beam of arcane energy. Roll a spell attack using the wand. On a hit the the target takes force damage equal to {@dice 1d10} plus the wands bonus. If the dice roll of the attack is equal to or lower than 3, the wand misfires. You suffer {@damage 1d10} force damage and the wand can't be used again until the end of your next turn

item.name: Arcane Blaster
entries: Also known as Spell Snipers, these wood and metal staffs are magically enchanted to focus and amplify blasts of arcane energy.

In the hands of a non-spellcaster the arcane blaster is a two-handed martial ranged weapon with reload 1 and misfire 2. It deals {@damage 2d12} force damage with a range of 200/800. Proficiency in either firearms or heavy crossbow is sufficient for wielding this weapon. On a misfire you suffer {@damage 1d12} force damage and the weapon cannot be used again until the end of your next turn. The reload period is considered an arcane recharge period since the wand does not require ammunition.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls with this magic weapon.
If you are a spellcaster you can attune to the staff. Once attuned you can use it as an arcane focus and unlock these additional features:
If you are an Artificer (Artillerist) you can carve sigils into the staff to make it your Arcane Firearm.
You gain a bonus to your ranged spell attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency modifier rounded down.

entries.name: Sniper
entries: The range of any cantrip focused through the staff is doubled.

entries.name: Overcharge
entries: Before you cast a cantrip with a ranged spell attack, you can choose to take a penalty to the attack roll equal to your proficiency bonus. If you do so and the attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to double your proficiency bonus . You can deal this extra damage only once per turn. If the dice roll of an overcharge attack is equal to or lower than 3, the staff backfires the beam in your direction. Roll damage as if you had successfully hit your target.

entries.name: Arcane Ammunition
entries: You can bind a wand to the staff. The range of any spell cast by a wand bound with the staff is doubled and can benefit from the staff's magical bonus to attack and/or damage.

item.name: Arcane Blaster
entries: Also known as Spell Snipers, these wood and metal staffs are magically enchanted to focus and amplify blasts of arcane energy.

In the hands of a non-spellcaster the arcane blaster is a two-handed martial ranged weapon with reload 1 and misfire 2. It deals {@damage 2d12} force damage with a range of 200/800. Proficiency in either firearms or heavy crossbow is sufficient for wielding this weapon. On a misfire you suffer {@damage 1d12} force damage and the weapon cannot be used again until the end of your next turn. The reload period is considered an arcane recharge period since the wand does not require ammunition.
In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls with this magic weapon.
If you are a spellcaster you can attune to the staff. Once attuned you can use it as an arcane focus and unlock these additional features:
If you are an Artificer (Artillerist) you can carve sigils into the staff to make it your Arcane Firearm.
You gain a bonus to your ranged spell attack and damage rolls equal to half your proficiency modifier rounded down.

entries.name: Sniper
entries: The range of any cantrip focused through the staff is doubled.

entries.name: Overcharge
entries: Before you cast a cantrip with a ranged spell attack, you can choose to take a penalty to the attack roll equal to your proficiency bonus. If you do so and the attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to double your proficiency bonus . You can deal this extra damage only once per turn. If the dice roll of an overcharge attack is equal to or lower than 3, the staff backfires the beam in your direction. Roll damage as if you had successfully hit your target.

entries.name: Arcane Ammunition
entries: You can bind a wand to the staff. The range of any spell cast by a wand bound with the staff is doubled and can benefit from the staff's magical bonus to attack and/or damage.

entries.name: (Any Sword)
entries: This weapon holds the spirit of a master swordsman eager to pass on his finer techniques.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon.
It has the following additional properties:

entries.name: First Lesson
entries: While you are attuned to it, you gain proficiency in this weapon if you didn't already have it.

entries.name: Watch My Hands
entries: When you roll a natural 1 on an attack with this weapon, ethereal hands readjust your stance, granting you advantage on your next attack with it before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Student and Master
entries: When you roll a natural 20 on an attack with this weapon, a spectral sword strikes in tandem with your own, causing the attack to deal an additional {@dice 1d8} magical slashing damage. This additional damage is not doubled by the critical hit.

item.name: Metaphorical Keys
entries: These keys were forged by an ancient fey smith that hadn't quite grasped the concept of metaphor.
These keys are usually found in sets of {@dice 1d4 + 1}, and each key has 1 charge. While holding a key you can use a bonus action to expend its charge for one of the following effects:

entries.name: Key To Your Heart
entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until it takes damage.

entries.name: Key To Success
entries: You have advantage on the next attack roll, ability check or saving throw you make before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Key To Escape
entries: You, or a willing creature within 5 feet of you, teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

entries.name: Key To Understanding
entries: You gain the benefits of the spell comprehend languages for 1 hour. Additionally, you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks for one minute.

entries.name: Just a Key
entries: One non-magical lock you can see within 5 feet of you is locked or unlocked with an audible click.

item.name: Champion's Icon
entries: Some of history's most infamous brigands and beloved heroes have had this weapon at their side throughout the ages. It still commands the same fear and awe it always has, but only in the hands of those who truly know how to wield it.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon. Additionally, it has the following properties.

entries.name: Iconic Flourish
entries: When you roll initiative you can brandish the weapon in an awe-inspiring display of your skill. Choose up to 3 creatures with 30 feet of you that can see you, these creatures must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by you (your choice) until the end of their next turn or until they take damage.

entries.name: Unstoppable Challenger
entries: Once per day you can cast {@spell compelled duel} (DC 16) as a 1st-level spell without concentration. If you reduce the target of the spell to 0 hit points whilst the spell is active, you regain the ability to cast the spell without needing to wait 1 day.

entries.name: Marked History
entries: Anyone who touches the weapon is instantly made aware of your ownership over it, and knows the names and great deeds of every creature that has ever attuned to the weapon.

item.name: Sacrificial Dagger
entries: This ceremonial blade has passed through the hands of many cult leaders and religious high priests alike.

You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this weapon. Additionally, you may use it as a spellcasting focus. This weapon has 6 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6} charges at midnight. When you reduce a creature of size small or larger to 0 hit points you can expend 1 charge to make a sacrifice for one of the following effects:

entries.name: Fiendish Sacrifice
entries: The dagger now deals an additional {@damage 1d4} fire damage and you gain advantage on all Charisma ({@skill Deception} and {@skill Intimidation}) checks.

entries.name: Sacrifice To The Deep
entries: The dagger now deals an additional {@damage 1d4} cold damage, you gain a swim speed of 20 feet and you can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Ode To The Old Ones
entries: The dagger now deals an additional {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and you can telepathically communicate with creatures you can see within 30 feet of you, as long as they can understand at least one language.

entries.name: Prayer To The Gods
entries: The dagger now deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage, you gain {@dice 4d4} temporary hit points and you gain resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Divination (3 Charges)
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell augury} and speak with dead once each, without material components. Additionally, you can cast {@spell guidance} at will.
Each of these effects lasts for 1 hour. You can only have one effect active at a time, using another will end the previous one.

item.name: Oath Blade
entries: (Any Sword).It is said these blades can only be enchanted in the moment which a paladin first swears their oath.
You have a +1 bonus to weapon and attack rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the following additional properties.

entries.name: Oathsworn
entries: As an action, a willing creature touching the blade can swear an oath or make a promise of no more than 20 words. After this oath is sworn, it appears in the form of text on the blade. Any creature that can understand at least one language can read the text. The text disappears if the oath is fulfilled or no longer possible. Only one oath can be sworn at any one time, the user can nullify an oath as an action.

entries.name: Truth Seeker
entries: The Oath Blade has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 1} charges at dawn. As an action you can expend 1 charge to cast {@spell comprehend languages} or divine favour or 2 charges to cast {@spell zone of truth} (DC 16), bless, or branding smite as 2nd level spells. You may expend 1 charge to cast {@spell ceremony|XGE} but still require material components to do so.

entries.name: Oathbreaker
entries: If a creature breaks the oath it swore it takes {@damage 10d8 + 20} radiant damage, plus an additional {@damage 4d8} psychic damage for every 10 minutes they spend within 30 feet of the blade, and the blade blackens. When this happens no more oaths can be sworn on the blade, and the spells you can expend charges to cast are replaced with darkness , hellish rebuke, hex, wrathful smite and blindness/deafness as 2nd level spells for 2 charges, with a spell save DC of 16.

item.name: Crown of the Mad Mage King
entries: This once mundane crown has absorbed the power of a long dead sorcerer king. The crown has 10 Charges and it regains {@dice 1d8 + 2} charges at Dawn. While attuned to, and wearing, this crown you gain the following abilities.

entries.name: Royal Presence (4 Charges)
entries: As an action you can create an aura of 10 foot radius centered on yourself for 1 minute. A creature that begins or ends its turn in this aura must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by or {@condition frightened} of you for one hour, or until you attack it. Creatures that succeed on this saving throw are immune to this ability for 24 hours.

entries.name: Eloquent Speech
entries: You gain proficiency in intimidation and persuasion, and you have advantage on Charisma (intimidation and persuasion) checks made against creatures {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by your royal presence. Additionally, all creatures within 30 feet of you that know at least one language can understand you when you speak.

entries.name: Royal Decree (2 Charges)
entries: You can cast the spells {@spell command} (2nd level) and {@spell sanctuary} (1st level) with a spell save DC of 17, and without material or somatic components. Creatures {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by your royal presence have disadvantage on their saving throws against these spells.

entries.name: Kneel Before Your King (4 Charges)
entries: As an action you can force all creatures within 15 feet of you to make a DC 17 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creatures take {@damage 4d8} psychic damage, are knocked {@condition prone} and are {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. On a success they take half as much damage and are pushed back 10 feet.

entries.name: Such Tasks Are Beneath Me
entries: You can cast the spells {@spell mage hand}, {@spell prestidigitation} and {@spell unseen servant} at will, without material or somatic components.

entries.name: Know Your Place
entries: You have advantage on saving throws made against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by a creature you can see and hear. If you succeed on such a saving throw you may use your reaction to deal {@damage 2d8} psychic damage to the creature that caused it.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This crown is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you suffer paranoid delusions that you are of extreme importance and someone is out for your title. You have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws to discern whether or not illusions are real, and you require an extra hour of rest to gain the benefits of a short rest, as your sleep is disturbed by your fear. You can break the curse in the usual ways.

item.name: Lamp of Minor Wishes
entries: It is unknown whether a genie truly dwells within this ornate oil lamp, or if it is powered by much lesser magic.
This item has 3 charges. You can use an action to rub the lamp and expend 1 charge to make one of the following wishes:

entries.name: Fortune
entries: Two coins appear in your hands, or at your feet if your hands are full. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a result of 1-2 the coins are copper, on a result of 3-4 they're silver and on a result of 5-6 they're gold.

entries.name: Power
entries: For the next hour all of your spell and weapon attacks deal an additional 2 force damage.

entries.name: Knowledge
entries: A large tome appears before you. A creature holding this tome has advantage on Intelligence checks. This tome disappears after 1 hour.

entries.name: Immortality
entries: You gain {@dice 2d4} temporary hit points and a small, ethereal picture of you is magically transported to a random location on your current plane of existence.

entries.name: Magic
entries: You can cast either {@spell prestidigitation} or {@spell thaumaturgy} (your choice) at-will. Additionally, you have advantage on all Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception} and {@skill Performance}) checks made to perform magic tricks or card tricks. These benefits last for 1 hour.

entries.name: Love
entries: A voice only you can hear declares its love for you. You regain {@dice 1d4} hit points and a rose appears at your feet.

A creature cannot make the same wish more than once per day. A creature holding this lamp at dawn can wish for more wishes, no matter how many charges the item has remaining. Doing so restores all expended charges.

item.name: Hilt of the Elements
entries: This hilt is warm to touch and swirls with elemental energy. As an action you can speak the command word, causing the hilt to form a stone weapon with an appearance of your choice. This weapon uses the statistics of a mace and has a +1 bonus to damage and attack rolls. This item has 4 charges and regains
{@dice 1d4} expended charges at dawn. As a bonus action you can expend 2 charges to imbue this weapon with an element, giving it one of the following sets of properties.

entries.name: Earth
entries: The weapon now deals {@damage 2d4} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, and gains the heavy and versatile ({@dice 2d6}) properties. Additionally, it deals double damage to nonmagical objects that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Wind
entries: The weapon becomes a ranged weapon with a range of of 30/60 and it gains the light property, dealing {@damage 1d6} + your Dexterity modifier slashing damage. Once per turn you can cause a creature of size medium or smaller hit by this weapon to be pushed back 10 feet in a straight line.

entries.name: Water
entries: The weapon gains the finesse and reach properties, and now deals cold damage. Additionally, your attacks with this weapon ignore half cover and the effects of fighting underwater.

entries.name: Fire
entries: The weapon gains the thrown (20/60) and versatile ({@dice 1d8}) properties, now deals fire damage and shines bright light in a 5 foot radius. When thrown you can recall it to your hand as a bonus action. Once per turn, when you make a successful attack roll you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage to the target.

You become proficient in the use of this weapon when you attune to it. The weapon and any properties it has remain until you dismiss them as a bonus action. Only one set of properties may be active at a time, if you select a new set the old one disappears.

item.name: Ring of Orbiting
entries: While holding this ring you can use a bonus action to speak a command word, causing it to slowly orbit around you at an axis of your choice. You can end this effect as a bonus action.
A creature attempting to grab ring must succeed on a DC 12 Strength check or fail to do so.

item.name: Sword of Deception
entries: (Any Sword).When you make a successful attack roll with this weapon, you can choose for it to deal no damage and become covered in illusory blood for 1 minute. When you miss an attack roll with this weapon you can choose for it to create an illusory sound that sounds as if the attack had hit.

item.name: Shredded Threads
entries: While wearing these clothes you can use a bonus action to flex, causing them to rip and tear in random places and granting you advantage on Charisma (intimidation) checks until the end of your next turn.
The clothes can be torn in this way once per day and repair themselves at dawn.

item.name: Delicious Armour
entries: (Any Armor).This armor constantly smells and tastes of baked goods and fresh fruit. It is nonetheless inedible.

item.name: Mystical Quill
entries: This quill never runs out of ink and can be used as a spellcasting focus. While it's within 30 feet of you, you can use an action to command it to write a message of no more than 10 words that you speak or think on a surface or in the air. A message written in the air is illusory and lasts for 10 minutes or until a creature uses an action to wipe it away.

item.name: Pipe of Softness
entries: When you smoke from this pipe you can choose for the pipe to emit flower petals, bird feathers or bubbles instead of smoke. This objects disappear at the end of your turn.

item.name: Sword of Artistry
entries: (Any Sword).While you hold this weapon you can make an image of your choice appear on the blade. Additionally, you can use the weapon as a set of {@item painter's supplies|PHB} that never runs out of paint, or a piece of chalk that never runs out.

item.name: Ring of Censorship
entries: A creature wearing this ring has any curse words they speak replaced with bird cries and rude hand gestures they make covered by swirling lights. Additionally, any curse words they hear are replaced with silence and they perceive rude hand gestures as black bars.

item.name: Item of Raw Power
entries: (Any weapon or spellcasting focus)
Whenever you cast a spell or make an attack roll with this item, it crackles with harmless lightning, is wreathed in harmless flames or emits a bright light (your choice).

item.name: Holographic Amulet
entries: As a bonus action you can speak a command word that causes a 1x1 illusory screen to appear above the amulet. This screen tells you the current time, which way is north and the predicted weather for your immediate area over the next 4 hours. The screen can also replicate maps you have studied for at least 10 minutes. You can dismiss it as a bonus action.

item.name: Confusing Blindfold
entries: You can see through this blindfold but you are {@condition deafened} while you wear it.

item.name: Mace of Roses
entries: When you land a successful attack roll with this weapon, you can choose for its head to explode into a mass of thorny roses. The target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage and {@dice 2d6} fresh roses appear around it. The weapon is destroyed and a large white rose takes it place.

item.name: Scholarly Spectacles
entries: While wearing these spectacles you can mentally command the pages of any book you are reading to turn on their own and you can read text you can see from up to 1 mile away.

item.name: Gambler's Ring
entries: As a bonus action while wearing this ring, you can manifest a tangible yet ethereal set of playing cards or dice, allowing it to be used as a {@item gaming set|PHB}. You can dismiss these items as a bonus action.

entries.name: (Any Armor)
entries: While this item isn't being worn or carried it is edible. It takes 10 minutes to consume and provides 1 day's worth of nourishment for up to 4 people. It tastes of venison and wine.
